Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst- Geocoding, Opendata, exploratory data analysis, NLP




Want to Help Revolutionise Last-Mile Logistics with Precision and Efficiency?




Interested? Join the Data Analytics Team!




We've partnered with a leading german startup who provide a geo-based and AI powered product to help transform the last mile logistics industry. Imagine building a product which is used by industry leaders such as AWS and google.




Were looking for Data analysts who have experience in :




processing geocode requests and working in an open source proprietary data platform.
Experienced in either ( Python, Node, Kotlin, Java, Node Js).
Experienced in working with Geospatial data projects.




On top of this if you are interested in working in an environment which prioritises Machine learning and NLP then this role will be for you!

Title: Data Analyst - Spatial Data
Description:
Looking for an opportunity to work with large-scale geospatial data in a dynamic and innovative environment? Passionate about turning raw data into actionable insights and collaborating with cross-functional teams?




We're recruiting a Data Analyst on behalf of our clients in Berlin, a forward thinking tech startup. This is a great opportunity to join their team and contribute to building a scalable, high-performing platform that serves billions of requests. This role focuses on statistical analysis, KPI reporting, and supporting data-driven decision-making to enhance product performance.




Key responsibilities:

Own and streamline KPI reporting processes to track system performance and quality metrics.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to identify and drive optimizations.
Analyze complex data streams to answer key stakeholder questions and provide actionable insights.
Build dashboards and visualizations to communicate findings effectively.
Contribute to data exploration and migration initiatives, supporting infrastructure improvements.




Key skills:

Solid experience with SQL and your preferred data tools or languages (e.g., Python, Java, Node.js).
Strong expertise in KPI reporting and visualization tools, such as AWS Quicksight or alternatives
Ability to derive insights from unstructured data and present findings to diverse audiences.
Collaborative mindset with experience working across engineering, product, and business teams.
Proactive and self-driven problem-solving approach with excellent communication skills in English.




Bonus points for:

Experience analyzing geospatial data or data quality metrics.




Interested, or know someone who would be? Click Apply or get in touch directly on iroghina@trg-uk.com

Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (all genders) Full Time, Berlin
Description:
Here at BARFER’S we love pets and want to revolutionize the pet food market.

With a selection of over 280 premium products developed and produced in-house in Berlin, we are already setting new standards to promote the health and well-being in the pet care market. Whether through our online shop or one of our eight stores in Berlin, Potsdam, and Hamburg, we make BARF accessible to everyone who wants the very best for their animals. BARF stands for biologically appropriate raw food and has been around since 1993.

This vision drives our team of more than 100 employees every single day. Together, we are making a lasting impact on the pet care industry – and we’re continuing to grow.

Join our pack and help us actively shape the future of the pet care market!

Here at BARFERs we want to build the e-commerce organization of the future, where data drives all our decision-making. To drive this vision you will design processes, define KPIs, build dashboards, and design predictive models to inform business and product decisions. In this role, you drive data solutions at scale by being the primary partner to our Commercial, Marketing and IT Teams.

Using your technical skills, business acumen, and creativity, you will build automated data solutions that provide tactical and strategic insights. As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will combine technology and innovation to organize data, enable insights and create the world’s most data-driven and efficient organization. You will lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects using your analytics, visualization, and data warehousing expertise, manage project schedules, identifying risks, and communicating them with clarity to project stakeholders. You're equally versed at explaining your team's analyses to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.

Aufgaben


Partner closely with the Marketing and Commercial teams, understand their data needs, and address those with intelligent data solutions in a timely, scalable and sustainable fashion.
Partner with our Data Engineering and Technical BI teams to enhance data infrastructure, data availability, and broad access to commercial and financial insights made available through self-service Power BI/Looker dashboards.
Solve complex business problems through understandable statistical solutions, enabling the business to make better decisions and complete their responsibilities more efficiently.
Work closely with each department head to conduct business and financial analysis, including pricing, forecasting and monitoring of key business activity.
Identify data points and proactively develop new metrics and analysis.
Implement Machine Learning and Predictive Modeling algorithms to support automated forecasting.



Qualifikation


E-commerce experience is a must.
Experience working in a high-paced environment.
Open, entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to build trust and partnerships easily.
You like to work in ambiguous environments and are not afraid to try and learn.
You are a self-starter that takes ownership: You always help, no matter your job description.
You are hands-on and always keep the long-term goals as a priority.
You have a degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Finance and/or other quantitative fields.
3+ years of experience in Analytics or Business Intelligence, performing quantitative analysis in a commercial context.
You’re skilled at querying and building databases (SQL, Big Query) and have proven experience building data visualizations with e.g.: Power BI, Power Pivot or Looker.
You have gained first experience with Python or other relevant scripting languages.
You can explain technical concepts and analysis implications clearly to a wide audience, including senior executives, and be able to translate business objectives into actionable analyses.
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills are preferred.



Benefits


Competitive compensation package depending on your experience.
30 days of vacation per year – plus an extra day off on your birthday, just for you!
An exciting opportunity to join a well-funded and fast-growing German e-commerce start-up, where you can help build and shape the company from the ground up!
Fast-moving, ambitious & entrepreneurial culture, strong career development, and growth opportunities.
We’re dog-friendly! Bring your dog along to work.



Sounds exciting?

Apply now! We can’t wait to get to know you!

At BARFERs we value a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we believe it is the key to innovation and happy employees. BARFERs is committed to providing an open, friendly, safe, and welcoming environment for every employee. We are delighted to receive applications from diverse candidates including gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, and religious beliefs

BARFERs does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our job’s alias, BARFERs employees or any other organization location. BARFERs will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
GEMEINSAM ERFOLGREICH

Sie suchen eine neue Herausforderung? Sie möchten Ihre Karriere in eine neue Richtung lenken? Sie möchten etwas bewegen?

Unser Data Intelligence & Digital Enablement Team in Deutschland schafft durch den Einsatz von Daten, Technologien und innovativen Lösungen echten Mehrwert für unser Business. Wir treiben die digitale Transformation des Unternehmens voran, managen zentrale Enterprise Applikationen und unterstützen unsere operativen Business- und Research-Teams bei der Erweiterung, Pflege, Konsolidierung, Analyse und Visualisierung einer einzigartigen Immobiliendatenlandschaft.

Für unser Team suchen wir ab sofort einen Data Analyst (m/w/d) in Berlin, Hamburg oder Frankfurt am Main.

Als Data Analyst (m/w/d) steuern Sie zentrale Datenprojekte für CBRE-Standorte in Deutschland, entwickeln unsere cloud-basierte Datenplattform weiter und automatisieren Prozesse, um datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu ermöglichen.

IMMOBILIEN – WIR MACHEN DAS

CBRE ist – in Bezug auf den Umsatz im Geschäftsjahr 2023 – der größte globale Immobiliendienstleister. Mit mehr als 130.000 Mitarbeitern in über 100 Ländern steht CBRE Investoren und Immobiliennutzern als Partner für alle Immobilienbelange weltweit zur Seite. Wir bieten unseren Kunden ein breites Spektrum an integrierten Leistungen aus einer Hand – über den gesamten Lebenszyklus einer Immobilie hinweg.

DAS MACHEN SIE BEI UNS


(Weiter-)Entwicklung und Verwaltung zentraler Business Intelligence (BI) Produkte für den Geschäftsbereich Property Management (PM) in enger Abstimmung mit den relevanten internen Stakeholdern
Bearbeitung von hoch priorisierten neuen Anwendungsfällen aus dem Anforderungskatalog der PM-Plattform mithilfe von Datenbankabfragen und BI Tools in enger Abstimmung mit dem Data Engineering Team
Überprüfung und gegebenenfalls Neuentwicklung existierender PM-Datenmanagement-Prozesse
Dokumentation bestehender und zukünftiger datenbezogener Anwendungsfälle von PM
Erstellung eines Datenkatalogs inklusive Data Lineage und Business Glossary
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Continental Europe Data Teams zur Anpassung regionaler Tools an den lokalen Kontext
Eigenständige, proaktive Weiterbildung und Recherche in PM-relevanten Themen mithilfe von internen und externen Ressourcen


DAS HABEN SIE ZU BIETEN


Master-Abschluss (Universität/FH) in Wirtschaftsinformatik, Geoinformatik, Wirtschaftsmathematik, quantitativ-orientierter Geographie oder vergleichbaren Studiengängen
Fachkenntnisse und/oder Praxiserfahrung in der Immobilienwirtschaft, idealerweise mit Fokus Property Management
Idealerweise 1-2 Jahre relevante Berufserfahrung in fortgeschrittener Datenanalyse auf Datenbankebene (PostgreSQL & Snowflake), Datenqualitätsmanagement, Datenvisualisierung und Projektmanagement
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in der Datenbanksprache SQL sowie im Umgang mit BI-Tools (z.B. Tableau, Alteryx) sind zwingend erforderlich
Grundkenntnisse in Programmiersprachen wie Python oder R sind von Vorteil
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in MS Office365 (Excel, Powerpoint, Teams, Planner, OneNote)
Kenntnisse in Datenvisualisierung und Graphikdesign sind von Vorteil
Hervorragende schriftliche und verbale Kommunikationsfähigkeit auf Deutsch und Englisch; sehr gute organisatorische und analytische Fähigkeiten; sorgfältige, proaktive und verlässliche Arbeitsweise; gute Präsentationsfähigkeit
Kundenorientierte, enthusiastische, hands-on, problemlösungs- und innovationsorientierte Grundeinstellung


DAS BIETEN WIR IHNEN


Wir machen flexibles und mobiles Arbeiten möglich: Egal ob im Büro, zu Hause, unterwegs oder während einer Workation
Werden Sie Teil des einzigartigen CBRE-Spirits und profitieren Sie von schnellen Entscheidungswegen und Duz-Kultur
Bleiben Sie mobil mit unserem Fahrtkostenzuschuss zum ÖPNV
Durch das offene high-end Bürokonzept leben wir täglich unsere Unternehmenskultur auf Augenhöhe
Erfolge zusammen feiern! Dafür gibt es Gelegenheit bei regelmäßigen Team-Events
Profitieren Sie von weiteren Benefits wie Familienservice, Corporate Benefits, Betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Sonderkonditionen für Fitnessstudios, JobRad u.v.m


MACHEN SIE MIT?

Werden Sie Teil unserer Erfolgsgeschichte! - Wir freuen uns über Ihre Bewerbung als Data Analyst (m/w/d) über unser Online-Bewerbungssystem, inklusive Lebenslauf, Anschreiben und relevanten Zeugnissen.

Bitte beachten Sie, dass wir aus Datenschutzgründen leider keine Bewerbungen per E-Mail annehmen können.

Bei Rückfragen zur Stellenanzeige wenden Sie sich gerne per E-Mail an unser Talent Acquisition Team: bewerbung@cbre.com


Show more

  • Grundkenntnisse in Programmiersprachen wie Python oder R sind von Vorteil
  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in MS Office365 (Excel, Powerpoint, Teams, Planner, OneNote)
  • Kenntnisse in Datenvisualisierung und Graphikdesign sind von Vorteil
  • Hervorragende schriftliche und verbale Kommunikationsfähigkeit auf Deutsch und Englisch; sehr gute organisatorische und analytische Fähigkeiten; sorgfältige, proaktive und verlässliche Arbeitsweise; gute Präsentationsfähigkeit
  • Kundenorientierte, enthusiastische, hands-on, problemlösungs- und innovationsorientierte Grundeinstellung

  • Wir machen flexibles und mobiles Arbeiten möglich: Egal ob im Büro, zu Hause, unterwegs oder während einer Workation

  • Durch das offene high-end Bürokonzept leben wir täglich unsere Unternehmenskultur auf Augenhöhe

  • Profitieren Sie von weiteren Benefits wie Familienservice, Corporate Benefits, Betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Sonderkonditionen für Fitnessstudios, JobRad u.v.m

MACHEN SIE MIT?

Werden Sie Teil unserer Erfolgsgeschichte! - Wir freuen uns über Ihre Bewerbung als Data Analyst (m/w/d) über unser Online-Bewerbungssystem, inklusive Lebenslauf, Anschreiben und relevanten Zeugnissen.

Title: Data Analyst in MarTech (Relocation to Tallinn)
Description:
As a Data Analyst in a Marketing team, you’ll play a central role in Bolts Global's marketing operations - helping us decide where we focus our time and money.




If you are passionate about data analysis, A/B testing, and impacting the way decisions are made that affect millions of customers and millions of euros in marketing spend - you’ll be at the right place in Bolt!




About the role

As a Senior Data Analyst in the Marketing team, you’ll ensure we’re making the best decisions. You’ll work closely with our teams to measure the impact of millions of euros spent on advertising brand campaigns, to identify the marketing communications that have the highest performance, and to recommend to our global and local teams serving the 30+ countries the best ways to spend their time and budgets.




In your job, you’ll be working closely with our marketing and business management teams as well as our industry partners (Google, Meta, TikTok, etc.)




Main tasks and responsibilities:

Conduct in-depth analysis of marketing investments to recommend the optimal budget allocations between channels, markets, and specific campaigns - following the existing frameworks.
Collaborate with marketing specialists and managers to design and analyze A/B tests for marketing communications initiatives with minimal supervision
Provide data-driven insights and recommendations to the marketing teams and leadership supporting day-to-day operations, business reviews and strategic decision-making
Support the stakeholders with ad-hoc analysis and bring visibility by building dashboards and reports.




About you:

Bachelors/Master’s degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics or Business
At least 2 years of experience dealing with large volumes of data
Outstanding SQL skills, a solid grasp of Python/R for data analysis and good understanding of statistics for A/B testing and experimentation
Fluent with at least one of the BI tools (Looker, Tableau, PowerBI, Qlik, DataStudio, Metabase, etc) and data visualization in general
Fluent in English and excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations
Extra bonus, but not required - experience with marketing and consumer analytics, marketing mix modeling, and/or Bayesian statistics




Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don’t tick every box, please consider applying if you feel you’re the kind of person described above!




Why you’ll love it here:

Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.
Impact millions of customers and partners in 500+ cities across 45 countries.
Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world.
Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.
Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.
Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode.
Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.




*Some perks may differ depending on your location.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Location: Berlin-Germany


Job Purpose and Background

Are you passionate about securing the future of the planet by preventing catastrophic climate change? Do you want to apply your considerable creativity, energy, and digital expertise at the cutting edge of corporate climate action in one of the world’s fastest-growing sustainability initiatives?

The Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi) has an exciting opportunity for a Data analyst. Joining the growing Data & Technology team within the SBTi’s global operations team, you will collaborate closely with the Impact team to ensure that the SBTi Data is used effectively to create impact within the climate community.


About you

You have strong analytical skills and enjoy complex, unstructured problems involving data. Curiosity comes naturally and you are open and adaptable to change as you seek to first understand and then validate your hypothesis. Adaptable to change but focused on KPIs and goals to ultimately measure and deliver value in a continuous fashion to SBTi. Able to consolidate and teach best practices and help foster a culture of data excellence within the organization. English is the working language at SBTi and the ability to communicate at a business fluent level is needed.


About the Science-Based Targets initiative

The Science Based Targets Initiative (SBTi) is a global body enabling businesses and financial institutions to set ambitious emissions reduction targets in line with the latest climate science. It is focused on accelerating companies across the world to halve emissions before 2030 and achieve net-zero emissions before 2050.


Key Responsibilities

  • Lead on data cleaning and data quality assessment exercises;
  • Consolidate multiple data sources by integrating and standardizing the information into a new, unified template;
  • Support data analysis and internal decision-making by creating data visualization frameworks and dashboards;
  • Provide insights from the data analysis based on the specific requests
  • Provide workshops and training to support SBTi staff in developing skills to support the organizational goal of data excellence;
  • Collect and document team feedback to be fed into organizational change management projects to improve the use of data at SBTi;
  • Work within project teams as a data expert and contribute to project success by ensuring data is being handled and used in the best way possible;
  • Build and maintain integrations between enterprise systems and support collaboration between organizational dataflows;


Essential skills and experience

  • Experience working with unsanitized data, cleaning, and transforming to high-quality data that can then be easily transferred to information systems;
  • Experience working extensively with Google Sheets and Excel with knowledge of advanced commands needed to organize data to gain insights;
  • Proficiency and understanding of Python, SQL, and/or other data science platforms to understand the connections and calls between databases;
  • Proficiency with data visualization tools such as Google Looker Studio, and or other visualization platforms to accurately display data reports as needed by SBTi climate scientists;
  • Experience in working with and designing structured and unstructured databases, terminology, and otherwise to both understand, improve, and build on SBTi core databases;
  • Ability to work remotely and flexibly in a global environment with limited direct supervision;


Important information before you apply.

  • This is a full-time role based in Berlin, Germany.
  • The salary for this role will depend on location and experience level.
  • This role is a fixed-term contract for 12 months with the possibility of extension.
  • This role holds a maximum 6-month probationary period, depending on country legislation.
  • Interested candidates should be legally allowed to work in the specified countries and already be visa holders. The SBTi cannot sponsor working visas.


What we offer

  • Competitive NGO salary;
  • Working in one of the most successful and fastest-growing initiatives driving climate action;
  • Exciting and challenging tasks in a dynamic, international, innovative, and motivated team;
  • Training and development;
  • Attractive holiday package;
  • Salary Range for Germany: 54k - 70k euros gross per year. (maximum top candidate accomplishes all the skills)


The SBTi is an equal opportunity employer - committed to building an inclusive workplace and diverse staff, where all can thrive. We welcome and strongly encourage applications from candidates of all identities and backgrounds, and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, gender or gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or age.

Title: Data Analyst - EU Marketing
Description:
About the team:

We are on a mission to build the ultimate go-to-market engine. To help us to achieve our mission, we are seeking a Data Analyst to strengthen the Global Analytics Team and support SumUp's strategic Marketing initiatives. This role partners with Marketing leadership to identify business needs, then construct data models, generate reports and dashboards, offer advanced analysis and actionable insights to drive improvement in our online channels. You will make a significant contribution to the business by being a valued business partner, a member of an experienced data team and by actively participating in the development of the analytics chapter.

What you'll do:


Create efficient data models that track Online Marketing funnel performance and KPIs, from ad spend to product activation.
Use data to drive analysis and actionable recommendations to shape Marketing program design, operations, and strategy
Partner with Marketing leadership and Strategic Finance to set performance targets, define KPIs, create scalable reporting and forecasts, and provide insight to drivers of pacing against goals
Collaborate closely with Senior Leadership to develop and evaluate Marketing strategies based on data-aware insights and qualitative analysis
Develop advanced dashboards to facilitate self-service analytics for the Marketing teams as well as SumUp Leadership
Drive strategic data OKRs aligned with SumUp's business goals, such as ICP analysis and readout
Partner with Analytics Engineers to ensure that data is properly collected, stored, processed, and accessible for analytics


You’ll be great for this role if you have:


A good understanding of marketing data flows, processes and industry level analytical practices (attribution models, cohorts)
Experienced in an analytical role at a high-growth tech company, including at least 1 year of hands-on experience with data analytics, data model design, dbt, and collaborative development using Git
Hands-on experience in developing advanced dashboards following industry best practices, preferably using Tableau
The ability to analyze Online Marketing and GTM needs and turn them into KPIs, insights, data models, and dashboards
Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills, with the ability to identify trends and key insights from unclear data.
Excellent communication skills and a strategic mindset to effectively collaborate with leadership
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to apply quantitative analysis and logical reasoning to inform and influence business decisions


Why you should join SumUp:

🌍 Opportunity to work with SumUppers globally on large-scale fintech products used by millions of businesses worldwide, from our Berlin office. This involves an office-first setup.

🌈 Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion: Be part of a workplace that values and promotes diversity, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone's perspectives are respected and embraced

📚 A dedicated annual L&D budget of €2,000 for attending conferences and/or advancing your career through further education.

🚀 Enrolment onto our VSOP program: You will own a stake in SumUp’s future success

💶 A corporate pension scheme where we match up to 20% of your contributions

🔄 30 Days Sabbatical: Enjoy the unique opportunity to take a well-deserved break with our 30 days sabbatical benefit after completing 3 years of employment with SumUp.

🔗 Referral Bonus: Earn additional rewards by referring talented individuals to join the SumUp team.

🚵🏾‍♂️ Numerous other benefits such as Urban Sports Club subsidy, Kita placement assistance, relocation assistance, subsidised office lunches.

SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by Company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.

About us:

SumUp is a leading financial technology company, founded in 2012 with the goal of empowering small businesses around the globe. We’re the financial partner of choice for more than 4 million merchants in over 35 markets. We collectively build, plan and fine-tune the technology that drives SumUp and empowers small businesses around the world.

We believe in the everyday hero. Those who have the courage to follow their passion and who have the strength and determination to realise their dreams. Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we're creating powerful, easy-to-use financial solutions to help them run their business. With a founders mentality and a 'team-first attitude' our diverse teams across Europe, South America, and the United States work together to ensure that small business owners can be successful doing what they love.

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don’t tick every box, it’s ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.
Show more

Title: Senior Data & Analytics Specialist (w/m/d)
Description:
Company Description

At Enpal, we are pursuing the dream of building the largest renewable community in Europe. How do we make that happen? Enpal finally simplifies providing solar energy: We rent out solar systems, electricity storage, and wall boxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a favorable green electricity tariff; all intelligently connected to form an integrated overall solution. True to the motto "digital, decentralized, and 100% renewable", our heart beats both for the rapid development of a company and for combating the greatest challenge of our generation - climate change.

Job Description


Work closely with the Heat Pump division stakeholders to design, build, and maintain automated data pipelines and ensure the best-in-class reporting infrastructure.
Implement and maintain automated Reporting for different business units to provide visibility and performance tracking across segments.
Develop deep knowledge of customer journey processes and use it to empower the business stakeholders to optimize the conversion funnel and achieve operational excellence.



Qualifications


5+ years of relevant experience in business intelligence, data analytics or similar roles.
Enthusiasm for working in dynamic, rapidly changing environments.
Strong ability to analyse data, identify patterns, and communicate. technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proven track record in automating data pipelines.
Exposure to Python for data analysis (e.g. pandas).
Our BI stack includes Snowflake, Streamlit, Tableau and dbt. Familiarity with the two latter ones is required/desired.
High proficiency in SQL and ETL processes.



Additional Information


The chance to be part of a fast-growing and future-oriented startup: we are one of the biggest players in the solar business.
A hybrid work model, the ability to come to our Berlin office every now and then for in person discussions and events, or to be there all the time - you decide.
Work with the best in the industry and grow with us: there’s plenty of room for your ideas.
Help to make the world a bit better: we are all about green energy.



At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.

Title: Data & Analytics Consulting - Analyst (m/d/f)
Description:
Who We Are




Oliver Wyman is a global management consultancy working across all areas of industry, financial services, government, and non-profit organizations. Clients approach us with their most significant challenges, and we assemble teams of experts to address each facet of these complex issues. Together, we create breakthroughs that lead to remarkable impact.

Within Oliver Wyman, the Data and Analytics (DNA) division was established in 2017 and is operating across the entire world, with a focus on Europe. We are a dynamic and rapidly growing team of quantitative analytics specialists, collaborating closely with colleagues across the firm to cover a global footprint, working across multiple industries including, but not limited to, Financial Services, Climate & Sustainability, Energy, Retail, and Transportation.

We believe in the power of diverse perspectives and collaborative teams to drive innovation. Our team comes from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences, and we embrace the unique skills and insights they bring to our work. At Oliver Wyman and within DNA, we are proud of the values we uphold that guide us every day in how we work and collaborate. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their full potential.




What You Will Do




As a member of Oliver Wyman’s Data & Analytics team, you will collaborate with colleagues and clients at all levels from your very first day, helping clients solve their most pressing challenges. Our DNA team is committed to developing tailored solutions for clients around the globe, including designing potential solutions for analytical challenges, implementing various prototypes while also assessing their effectiveness, and engaging in discussions with clients and colleagues to share ideas. Your contributions will be invaluable to delivering impactful results for our clients.

Notable projects include:

Developing an NLP-based machine learning toolkit to predict credit rating downgrades using news articles – click here for more information
Modelling portfolio decarbonization strategies leveraging advanced analytics techniques for large European banks
Optimizing and developing a promotional program using data from historical promotions for an Asian health & beauty chain by deploying a promotion analytics toolkit
Validating a customer-facing GenAI chatbot for an American bank
Developing probability of default and loss models in Python for European and UK-based banks
Identifying supply chain risks by combining multiple live data feeds, and developing and applying a bespoke AI based risk methodology – click here for more information
Developing a next best action model to reduce customer churn for a global telecom company




Why Join Us?




Expect a steep learning curve, as no two projects are ever the same. You’ll have the opportunity to travel internationally, gaining invaluable experiences and insights across different cultures and with access to the latest technologies, you’ll constantly expand your toolkit with each new endeavor.

You won’t be alone on this journey; various colleagues will guide and coach you throughout your career. You’ll have a dedicated buddy, a career adviser, and a talent manager to help you navigate your professional path. We also care deeply about sustainable work-life quality, providing you with the flexibility to balance your career aspirations with your personal life.

This role will empower you to embrace your curiosity and step out of your comfort zone. You will have the opportunity to work alongside genuine colleagues who measure success by the lasting impact we create together. If you’re excited by challenges and eager to make a meaningful impact, we look forward to welcoming you aboard!




Who Can Apply?




Bachelor's, Master’s, or PhD in a quantitative discipline from a top academic program (Data Science, Mathematics, Natural Sciences, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Data-driven mindset and proficiency with numbers, paired with the ability to explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner to clients and colleagues
Ideally, programming skills in Python or R, but more importantly, an eagerness to continuously extend your knowledge of technologies
Strong commitment to teamwork and resilience in a creative and constantly changing environment
Excellent command of German & English (verbal and written)
Interest and experience in financial services and risk management is a plus




How to Apply?




Please submit your CV, cover letter and transcripts. If you would like to find out more information about Oliver Wyman, please visit our website or alternatively, apply to attend one of our events, details of which can be found here.

Oliver Wyman is an equal opportunity employer and a wholly owned subsidiary of Marsh & McLennan Companies. To learn more, please follow us on LinkedIn, Instagram or Twitter. Marsh & McLennan Companies and its Affiliates are EOE Minority/Female/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity employers.




What to expect during the interviews process?




At Oliver Wyman, we want you to shine in your interview. Our process is designed like our work environment — it’s challenging, exciting, and fun.

With a mix of conversational and case interviews, our approach not only helps us to get to know you better, understanding your strengths and interests, but it also enables you to learn more about our people and our business.

If you want to learn more about consulting interviews and start your preparation, please visit our careers page: https://www.oliverwyman.com/careers/entry-level/interview-preparation.html

Show more

At Oliver Wyman, we want you to shine in your interview. Our process is designed like our work environment — it’s challenging, exciting, and fun.

With a mix of conversational and case interviews, our approach not only helps us to get to know you better, understanding your strengths and interests, but it also enables you to learn more about our people and our business.

Title: Data Analyst | Junior PM
Description:
This role requires presence in our Berlin office. Native German skills are required.

🌎 What we do

We build software that helps companies along the food system get to Net Zero.

~31% of global GHG emissions originate from food-related activities. For the first time in history, climate performance has become an overall business performance indicator. Enterprises are mandated by regulatory bodies to disclose their climate performance, which leads to increasing pressure from investors, competitors, retailers, and consumers to prevent and reduce their CO2e emissions. Over the next 10 years, companies have set ambitious reduction targets that need to be met. Enterprise software and new business processes can help.

We raised >€10m in funding in the first 2 years of our existence, we launched our enterprise product, signed and onboarded some of the largest F&B players in Europe, and put together what we believe is the best-suited early stage tech team in Europe. Will you be the next to join us? 🚀

🔭 What you will work on

Your mission

Help our users make sense of their data and pave the way to Net Zero Emissions.

Over the next 12 months you will:


Create Actionable Insights for Net Zero
Identify data patterns to help users understand and communicate their carbon footprints more effectively to customers and suppliers.
Turn emission data into clear, impactful analytics for users so they can make better decisions.
Bridge data to real-world measures - our users and farmers don’t live in spreadsheets.
Build Prototypes and Products
Develop models and prototypes to help clients set targets and model Net Zero scenarios.
Develop a strong understanding of our users and their unique challenges.
Work closely with the product team to transform prototypes into scalable SaaS products.
Upskill the Team with Data & AI
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends in data analytics and AI product building.
Empower self-service across teams.
Foster a data-first culture in a fast-growing environment where it’s easy to simply listen to your gut feeling.

🚀 You might be really good for this role if


You have a "get-it-done" attitude and the ability to learn really fast.
You have built products from scratch in the past, be it on your own or as part of a bigger undertaking inside your company.
You were part of the first 1-50 employees at an early stage technology company, no matter in what position.
You understand and care equally as much about the “why” behind the numbers, you think outcome-first.
You are highly reliable and can organise your work really well.


You don't feel like you fulfil all the criteria? We get it: confidence can sometimes hold us back from applying for a job. But guess what?! There is no such thing as a 'perfect' candidate. The only thing you need to ensure along the recruiting process and beyond is that the problem that we are solving with Root is one you cannot wait to get out of bed for on Monday morning! 🤗

🦾 How we support you


You will report to our co-founder Eric


Some of our angel investors that will actively mentor you:

General mentors for product


Vassili Samolis (Director Product @Doordash, ex-Instagram, ex-Pinterest)
Victor Landau (VP Product @cargo.one)


For more technical questions


Pete Hamilton (co-founder & CTO @incident.io)
Tevfik Aloglu (Co-founder @Pyne, ex-BCG DV, ex-Rocket Internet)


For collaboration with design


Jasson Schrock (first designer @Youtube after acquisition, ex-Google, ex-BCG DV)


🎢 Hiring Process

Our ambition is to offer you an end-to-end experience that is fast and uncomplicated - we aim to keep the end-to-end process to 10 working days. We send you prep material for each step and maximise transparency at every step.

Get Mentored By World-class Company Builders

We decided on our cap table with a clear goal in mind: Set our team up for success. This is why we have selected a diverse group of food industry veterans, generalist company builders, and functional experts to join our journey from day 1. Beyond entrusting us with their capital, our angel investors act as mentors and sparring partners for our early team members in their corresponding roles. You will benefit from:


A dedicated mentor with whom you will build your personal relationship
Regular sparring sessions whenever you see fit
Adhoc Q&A where needed


Not looking for a new role but know someone who does?

Refer a hire and get € 1,000 on the hand (or via Paypal if you are more old-school). Just forward the page to anyone that might be interested or directly message our team at hiring@rootglobal.io

_______

Root Global is an equal opportunity employer, which means we do not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
Show more

  • Build Prototypes and Products
    • Develop models and prototypes to help clients set targets and model Net Zero scenarios.
    • Develop a strong understanding of our users and their unique challenges.
    • Work closely with the product team to transform prototypes into scalable SaaS products.
  • Upskill the Team with Data & AI
    • Stay up-to-date with the latest trends in data analytics and AI product building.
    • Empower self-service across teams.
    • Foster a data-first culture in a fast-growing environment where it’s easy to simply listen to your gut feeling.
🚀 You might be really good for this role if

  • You have a "get-it-done" attitude and the ability to learn really fast.
  • You have built products from scratch in the past, be it on your own or as part of a bigger undertaking inside your company.
  • You were part of the first 1-50 employees at an early stage technology company, no matter in what position.
  • You understand and care equally as much about the “why” behind the numbers, you think outcome-first.
  • You are highly reliable and can organise your work really well.

You don't feel like you fulfil all the criteria? We get it: confidence can sometimes hold us back from applying for a job. But guess what?! There is no such thing as a 'perfect' candidate. The only thing you need to ensure along the recruiting process and beyond is that the problem that we are solving with Root is one you cannot wait to get out of bed for on Monday morning! 🤗

🦾 How we support you

  • You will report to our co-founder Eric

Some of our angel investors that will actively mentor you:

General mentors for product

  • Vassili Samolis (Director Product @Doordash, ex-Instagram, ex-Pinterest)
  • Victor Landau (VP Product @cargo.one)

For more technical questions

  • Pete Hamilton (co-founder & CTO @incident.io)
  • Tevfik Aloglu (Co-founder @Pyne, ex-BCG DV, ex-Rocket Internet)

For collaboration with design

  • Jasson Schrock (first designer @Youtube after acquisition, ex-Google, ex-BCG DV)

🎢 Hiring Process

Our ambition is to offer you an end-to-end experience that is fast and uncomplicated - we aim to keep the end-to-end process to 10 working days. We send you prep material for each step and maximise transparency at every step.

Get Mentored By World-class Company Builders

We decided on our cap table with a clear goal in mind: Set our team up for success. This is why we have selected a diverse group of food industry veterans, generalist company builders, and functional experts to join our journey from day 1. Beyond entrusting us with their capital, our angel investors act as mentors and sparring partners for our early team members in their corresponding roles. You will benefit from:

  • A dedicated mentor with whom you will build your personal relationship
  • Regular sparring sessions whenever you see fit
  • Adhoc Q&A where needed

Not looking for a new role but know someone who does?

Refer a hire and get € 1,000 on the hand (or via Paypal if you are more old-school). Just forward the page to anyone that might be interested or directly message our team at hiring@rootglobal.io

_______

Root Global is an equal opportunity employer, which means we do not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Company Description

At Enpal, we are pursuing the dream of building the largest renewable community in Europe. How do we make that happen? Enpal finally simplifies providing solar energy: We rent out solar systems, electricity storage, and wall boxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a favorable green electricity tariff; all intelligently connected to form an integrated overall solution. True to the motto "digital, decentralized, and 100% renewable", our heart beats both for the rapid development of a company and for combating the greatest challenge of our generation - climate change.

Job Description


Work closely with the Heat Pump division stakeholders to design, build, and maintain automated data pipelines and ensure the best-in-class reporting infrastructure.
Implement and maintain automated Reporting for different business units to provide visibility and performance tracking across segments.
Develop deep knowledge of customer journey processes and use it to empower the business stakeholders to optimize the conversion funnel and achieve operational excellence.



Qualifications


5+ years of relevant experience in business intelligence, data analytics or similar roles.
Enthusiasm for working in dynamic, rapidly changing environments.
Strong ability to analyse data, identify patterns, and communicate. technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proven track record in automating data pipelines.
Exposure to Python for data analysis (e.g. pandas).
Our BI stack includes Snowflake, Streamlit, Tableau and dbt. Familiarity with the two latter ones is required/desired.
High proficiency in SQL and ETL processes.



Additional Information


The chance to be part of a fast-growing and future-oriented startup: we are one of the biggest players in the solar business.
A hybrid work model, the ability to come to our Berlin office every now and then for in person discussions and events, or to be there all the time - you decide.
Work with the best in the industry and grow with us: there’s plenty of room for your ideas.
Help to make the world a bit better: we are all about green energy.



At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.
Show more

Title: (Senior) Associate Business Intelligence & Data Analytics (x/f/m)
Description:
Über Doctolib - Together, let’s build the healthcare we all dream of

Doctolib ist das führende europäische Scale-up im Gesundheitsbereich. Doctolib ist - auch nach französischen Recht - eine mission driven company mit zwei Missionen:


Gesundheitsfachkräfte stärken und ihnen ein besseres Arbeitsleben ermöglichen
Menschen zu helfen, gesünder zu leben und einen einfacheren und schnelleren Zugang zu medizinischer Versorgung zu haben



Seit der Gründung von Doctolib im Jahr 2013 schaffen wir Innovationen, indem wir ein vereintes Team mit Gesundheitsexperten bilden, Technologien entwickeln, die ihren Bedürfnissen entsprechen und greifbaren Wert schaffen. Mit Leidenschaft für die Transformation des Gesundheitswesens sind wir führend im Bereich digitaler Gesundheitstechnologien und streben danach, ein führendes KI-Unternehmen im Gesundheitswesen zu werden.

Mehr als 2.900 Doctolibers in Frankreich, Deutschland, Italien und den Niederlanden arbeiten an der Betreuung eines Netzwerks von mehr als 900.000 professionellen Anwendern und mehr als 90 Millionen Patienten.

Als Senior Analyst Business Intelligence & Data Analytics (x/f/m) unterstützt Du Monitoring und Analyse der Business Performance von Doctolib Deutschland in allen Funktionen, mit besonderem Fokus auf Wachstum, Effizienz und Nutzerzufriedenheit. Du bei der Vorbereitung strategischer Entscheidungen und dabei, unser operative Exzellenz durch datengestützte Erkenntnisse zu verbessern.

Deine Aufgaben


Business Performance Monitoring: Helfe bei der Entwicklung unser Business Performance Monitoring, um sicherzustellen dass wir jederzeit einen guten 360 Blick haben
Datengesteuerte Erkenntnisse: Analysiere komplexe Datensätze, um Trends, Chancen und Verbesserungsbereiche zu identifizieren und dem Managementteam Erkenntnisse zu liefern
Erweitere unsere Reportingsuite, indem du Reports und Datenprodukte z.B. in Tableau und MetaBase oder Salesforce baust
Kontinuierliche Verbesserung: Unterstütze Initiativen zu Prozessoptimierung und operativer Exzellenz und fördere eine Kultur der kontinuierlichen Verbesserung in der gesamten Organisation
Berichterstattung und Kommunikation: Erstelle und präsentiere Reports für das Führungsteam



Dein Profil


4+ Jahre Erfahrung in einer Business Performance Management als Data Analyst oder ähnlichen Rollen
Nachweisliche Erfolge bei der Nutzung von Datenanalysen zur Unterstützung von Geschäftsentscheidungen und zur Verbesserung der Performance
Starke analytische Fähigkeiten und die Fähigkeit, komplexe Daten zu klaren, umsetzbaren Erkenntnissen zu synthetisieren
Exzellente Kenntnisse von Datenanalysetools und Software (Tableau, MetaBase); Erfahrung mit Salesforce ist ein Plus
Erfahrung im Umgang mit Erfahrung in einem SaaS-Umfeld sowie von Performance Management in Marketing, Sales, Customer Success sind von Vorteil



Was wir Dir bieten


Ein strukturiertes Onboarding Programm - die Doctolib Academy
Ein Aktienoptionsprogramm für alle Doctoliber
28 Urlaubstage + 1 Tag zusätzlich für jedes vollendete Beschäftigungs-Kalenderjahr (max. 30 Tage)
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge
Erstattung der ÖPNV-Kosten
Eine vergünstigte Mitgliedschaft bei unserem Kooperationspartner Urban Sports Club
Angebote zur Unterstützung Deines mentalen Wohlbefindens durch Zugang zu Coaches und Psychologen in Zusammenarbeit mit moka.care
Das Doctolib Parent Care Programm, das extra Elternzeit (1 Monat), Eltern-Treffen und inspirierende Präsentationen enthält
Kontinuierliche Trainingsangebote zu verschiedenen Kompetenzen (z.B. Soft Skills, Fachkenntnisse & Know-how)
Verpflegungsgutscheine und gesunde Snacks im Büro, sowie regelmäßige Angebote zum Frühstück oder BBQ
Moderne, attraktive Büros, die zum Austausch einladen und das Wohlbefinden fördern
Regelmäßiges Teambuilding & weitere Veranstaltungen (Doctoberfest, Kids day…)



Der Interview-Prozess


Kennenlern-Interview mit Deinem Talent Partner
Interview mit Deinem Manager
Case Study
Finales Interview
Referenzgespräche



Job Details


Festanstellung / unbefristet
Vollzeit
Arbeitsort: Berlin
Startdatum: ab sofort
Arbeitsmodus: Hybrid



Wir verfolgen die Vision, die Gesundheit aller zu verbessern. Dies spiegelt sich auch im Recruiting wider. Wir evaluieren Bewerbungen ausschließlich auf der Grundlage von Qualifikation und Motivation. Diskriminierung wird bei uns nicht toleriert.

Je diverser unser Team und die Ideen sind, desto mehr wird unser Produkt die Gesundheit unserer Nutzer:innen verbessern können. Deshalb laden wir dich ein, dich bei uns zu bewerben, unabhängig von Geschlecht, Religion, Alter, sexueller Orientierung, ethnischer Herkunft oder Behinderung.

Um Chancengleichheit zu gewährleisten, kannst Du in deiner Bewerbung auf Angaben wie Fotos, Alter, etc. verzichten. Lass uns bitte wissen, welche Vorkehrungen wir treffen können, um Dich bestmöglich zu unterstützen. Wir freuen uns, mit Dir das Gesundheitswesen zu digitalisieren!

Alle bereitgestellten Informationen werden von Doctolib für das Bewerbungsmanagement verarbeitet. Für Details zur Datenverarbeitung klicke bitte hier.

Bei Fragen oder wenn Du Deine Rechte wahrnehmen möchtest, wende Dich bitte an hr.dataprivacy@doctolib.com.
Show more

Title: Lead Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Berlin, London, Remote

________________________

Hello 👋 I am Puneet, Co- founder and CPO at Kayzen, and I am now looking for a Lead Data Analyst who will be a part of the our Data Analytics ( Data ) team. 🙌

But wait, you have not heard of Kayzen before? 😃

Kayzen is a mobile demand-side platform (DSP) dedicated to democratizing programmatic advertising. We enable leading apps, agencies, media buyers, and brands to run programmatic customer acquisition, retargeting, and brand performance campaigns through its self-serve and managed service options.

Built on the three core pillars of performance, transparency, and control, Kayzen powers the world's best mobile marketing teams with bespoke solutions that fuel business growth and deliver a competitive advantage.

With an unprecedented scale of 160B+ daily ad requests from 1.6B+ unique users worldwide, we serve up to 1B+ ads per day in 180 countries. Kayzen is accessible through our APIs and user interface.

The role

As the Lead Data Analyst, you will ensure that the Data Analytics team consistently applies advanced descriptive, prescriptive, and predictive analytics to deliver high-value insights across multiple stakeholders. At Kayzen, our Data Analytics team operates within the broader "Data Team," which also includes Data Science and Machine Learning Engineering. Collectively, the Data Team develops and deploys the machine learning models that power our clients' advertising performance in the programmatic ecosystem.

Within this structure, the Data Analytics team serves as a critical bridge between the Data Team and the broader business units (e.g., campaign managers, business owners, product managers).

Through your leadership, you will champion a data-driven culture and empower teams across Kayzen to harness analytical insights in a consistent and impactful way.

Responsibilities

As a hands-on leader, you will combine technical prowess with strategic vision—driving complex analysis, mentoring team members, and tackling data challenges directly. You will address a variety of problems, such as feature engineering, A/B testing, fraud detection, bidding decisions to name a few examples. Your key responsibilities include:


Team Leadership & Mentorship: Guide and develop the Data Analytics team, ensuring the quality and impact of their deliverables.
Roadmap Definition: Shape both the Data Analytics roadmap and the broader Data Team roadmap, making decisions that align with business priorities and objectives.
Data-Driven Model Research: Provide in-depth research to inform machine learning model development, leveraging both internal and external data sources to generate actionable insights.
Analytical & Statistical Expertise: Serve as the primary source of rigorous analytics for various data problems, evaluating system performance , finding performance issues and devising solutions for them
Data Accessibility & Quality Control: Facilitate data access throughout the organization while maintaining a centralized oversight to guarantee data quality.


What this role is not about:


This is not a typical BI role, where you are just expected to receive requirements and build dashboards. At Kayzen, the Data Analyst role is more investigative and we need people capable to ask questions and to answer them.
This is not a campaign management role, where you will be responsible for operational campaign optimization.


Requirements


5+ years of experience in the Ad-Tech industry, working in Data Analytics or related fields;
SQL (advanced);
Python (intermediate);
Expertise in data mining, processing, modeling and data visualization and strong analytical skills;
A results-driven, hands-on mindset that combines rapid experimentation, pragmatic problem-solving, and a passion for delivering exceptional customer-focused solutions;
High level of proactiveness and eagerness to solve issues;
A strong sense of ownership and strong work ethics;
Experience with Big Data technologies (Spark, HDFS, Hive, etc) is a plus;
Experience with Git and Airflow is a plus.


What do we offer?


Reporting directly to Co-founder & CPO
Direct access to top management and an extremely "visible" role
Exceptional career growth and learning opportunity
A unique opportunity to be part of an experienced team of industry experts and entrepreneurs who bring massive change to the Adtech market
Direct, day-to-day work experience with the management
A fun, driven, and multinational team located across Germany, India, UK, Argentina, Ukraine, Turkey, Spain and many more countries
A flexible work-from-home arrangement
A 500-dollar home-office setup budget
A 1000-dollar annual learning and development budget
Show more

Title: Data Analyst e-health (m/w/d)
Description:
Gestalte mit uns die Zukunft von e-Health als Data Analyst (m/w/d)

Wir von docmetric suchen ausgezeichnete Data Analysts, die von unserer Mission "Niemand soll leiden oder gar sterben, nur weil einmal irgendwann, irgendwo wichtige medizinische Informationen fehlen.", getrieben sind. Es ist Deine Leidenschaft mittels neuester Tech-Stacks und Tools das Gesundheitswesen zu digitalisieren? Du hast Spaß an der Arbeit in einem interdisziplinären Team mit ausgeprägter Start-Up-Mentalität? Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine Bewerbung!

Dein Beitrag


Als Data-Analyst bist Du für die Bewertung von Datenquellen und die programmatische Aufbereitung, Anreicherung und Normalisierung von Daten in Python zuständig
Dabei verantwortest du die kontinuierliche Optimierung der Datenqualität
Du unterstützt uns beim Aufbau und der Weiterentwicklung interner Datenbanken und Datenstrukturen
Du analysierst strukturierte und unstrukturierte Daten aus einer Vielzahl von Quellen des Gesundheitswesens
Durch die Erstellung und Pflege von Reports und Dashboards übersetzt du Anforderungen interner und externer Stakeholder in die Welt der Daten


Das Bringst Du Mit


Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data Analytics, idealerweise in der Arbeit mit Gesundheitsdaten
Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich der (Medizin-) Informatik, Mathematik, Naturwissenschaften oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Erfahrung mit Python, Pandas, SQL sind ein Muss; Erfahrung mit Elasticsearch (oder vergleichbaren NoSQL Datenbanken) und PowerBI sind von Vorteil
Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift (mind. B1)
Ein agiles Mindset und eine Leidenschaft für die Analyse von Daten


Das Kannst Du Von Uns Erwarten


Sinn und Zweck: Werde Teil einer wichtigen Mission - An der Schnittstelle von Gesundheitswesen und Digitalisierung gestalten wir die Zukunft von e-Health.
Attraktive Standorte mit echten Communities: Bei uns stehen die Menschen und der Zusammenhalt im Mittelpunkt. Hierfür bieten wir Dir attraktive Standorte.
Flache Hierarchien: Best of Both Worlds - Wir sind ein Konzern mit stabilen Strukturen und absoluter Expertise, aber bieten Dir gleichzeitig ein agiles Umfeld mit flachen Hierarchien.
Gestaltungsspielraum: Du kannst in spannenden Projekten viel bewegen. Wir bieten Dir vielfältige Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten und langfristige Perspektiven
Rundum-Paket: Mitarbeiterrabatte, ein ausgereiftes Feel-Good-Management sowie weitere standortspezifische Angebote.


Überzeugt? Bewirb Dich jetzt online mit Deinen aussagekräftigen Bewerbungsunterlagen (inkl. Gehaltsvorstellung und nächstmöglichen Eintrittstermin).

We create the future of e-Health.

Werde Teil einer bedeutenden Mission.
Show more
HTML:
Gestalte mit uns die Zukunft von e-Health als Data Analyst (m/w/d)

Wir von docmetric suchen ausgezeichnete Data Analysts, die von unserer Mission "Niemand soll leiden oder gar sterben, nur weil einmal irgendwann, irgendwo wichtige medizinische Informationen fehlen.", getrieben sind. Es ist Deine Leidenschaft mittels neuester Tech-Stacks und Tools das Gesundheitswesen zu digitalisieren? Du hast Spaß an der Arbeit in einem interdisziplinären Team mit ausgeprägter Start-Up-Mentalität? Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine Bewerbung!

Dein Beitrag

  • Als Data-Analyst bist Du für die Bewertung von Datenquellen und die programmatische Aufbereitung, Anreicherung und Normalisierung von Daten in Python zuständig
  • Dabei verantwortest du die kontinuierliche Optimierung der Datenqualität
  • Du unterstützt uns beim Aufbau und der Weiterentwicklung interner Datenbanken und Datenstrukturen
  • Du analysierst strukturierte und unstrukturierte Daten aus einer Vielzahl von Quellen des Gesundheitswesens
  • Durch die Erstellung und Pflege von Reports und Dashboards übersetzt du Anforderungen interner und externer Stakeholder in die Welt der Daten

Das Bringst Du Mit

  • Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data Analytics, idealerweise in der Arbeit mit Gesundheitsdaten
  • Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich der (Medizin-) Informatik, Mathematik, Naturwissenschaften oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
  • Erfahrung mit Python, Pandas, SQL sind ein Muss; Erfahrung mit Elasticsearch (oder vergleichbaren NoSQL Datenbanken) und PowerBI sind von Vorteil
  • Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift (mind. B1)
  • Ein agiles Mindset und eine Leidenschaft für die Analyse von Daten

Das Kannst Du Von Uns Erwarten

  • Sinn und Zweck: Werde Teil einer wichtigen Mission - An der Schnittstelle von Gesundheitswesen und Digitalisierung gestalten wir die Zukunft von e-Health.
  • Attraktive Standorte mit echten Communities: Bei uns stehen die Menschen und der Zusammenhalt im Mittelpunkt. Hierfür bieten wir Dir attraktive Standorte.
  • Flache Hierarchien: Best of Both Worlds - Wir sind ein Konzern mit stabilen Strukturen und absoluter Expertise, aber bieten Dir gleichzeitig ein agiles Umfeld mit flachen Hierarchien.
  • Gestaltungsspielraum: Du kannst in spannenden Projekten viel bewegen. Wir bieten Dir vielfältige Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten und langfristige Perspektiven
  • Rundum-Paket: Mitarbeiterrabatte, ein ausgereiftes Feel-Good-Management sowie weitere standortspezifische Angebote.

Überzeugt? Bewirb Dich jetzt online mit Deinen aussagekräftigen Bewerbungsunterlagen (inkl. Gehaltsvorstellung und nächstmöglichen Eintrittstermin).

We create the future of e-Health.

Werde Teil einer bedeutenden Mission.

Title: Social Media Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Daten über das Social Media Verhalten deiner Zielgruppe faszinieren dich? Du liebst es, aus einer großen, ungeordneten Menge an Zahlen, konkrete Schlüsse zu ziehen und dein gewonnenes Wissen für andere verständlich zu machen? Du bist außerdem detailverliebt und hast Lust neue Prozesse mitzugestalten?

Dann sucht unser Team Dich! Als Social Media Analyst (w/m/d).

Bewirb Dich! Auch wenn das Profil auf den ersten Blick nicht zu 100% passt.

Aufgaben


Auswertung und Analyse von Performance-Daten auf allen relevanten Social-Media-Kanälen
Nutzung von Analyse-Tools (Sprinklr, Google Analytics, Google Looker Studio etc.)
Ableiten und Präsentieren von relevanten Erkenntnissen und Empfehlungen
Optimierung/Automatisierung von Datenverarbeitung und Prozessen
Visuelle Datenaufbereitung & Dashboarding
Unterstützung von interdisziplinären Projektteams
Die Chance, mit einer der weltweit führenden Automobilmarken zu arbeiten



Qualifikation


Expertise im Bereich Social Media Analytics, zusätzliche Kenntnisse in Social-Media-Strategie und Advertising
Ein Gespür für Zahlen
Kompetenz im Umgang mit den aktuell relevanten Social-Media-Netzwerken
Fähigkeit zum Aufbau vertrauensvoller Kund:innenbeziehungen
Sicherer Umgang mit MS Office und eine unbändige Excel-Leidenschaft
Ausgezeichnete Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse
Interesse an der Automobilbranche ist von Vorteil



Benefits


Hybrides Arbeitszeitmodell mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten
Regelmäßige Teamevents
Bis zu vier Wochen im Jahr im EU-Ausland arbeiten
30 Urlaubstage für alle Mitarbeiter:innen
Unbefristeter Vertrag nach 6-monatiger Probezeit
Raum zur Entfaltung und zum eigenverantwortlichen Arbeiten in deiner neuen Rolle
Jährliches Weiterbildungsbudget mit individuellem Gestaltungsspielraum



Wer wir sind

Seit 2008 Kreativagentur und Unternehmensberatung mit über 200 sehr guten Leuten in Berlin-Kreuzberg.


Autonomie, Vertrauen und Gestaltungsspielraum sind unsere Vision der modernen Arbeitswelt von morgen.
Wir unterstützen uns gegenseitig und glauben an die kulturstiftende Wirkung von regelmäßigen Teamevents zur beruflichen und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung.
Diversity, Gleichberechtigung sowie eine gesunde Work-Life Balance gehören zu unseren wichtigsten Werten.
Unser transparenter Feedbackprozess trägt bei uns zu einer offenen und wertschätzenden Kommunikationskultur bei.
Wir wollen zu deinem Leben passen. Zur Unterstützung in jeder Lebensphase bieten wir den vollen Work-Life-Care-Service des Fürstenberg Instituts an.



Wir freuen uns über deine digitale Bewerbung unter Angabe deines optimalen Einstiegstermins.
Show more

Title: Staff Data Analyst
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to initiate and drive business decisions focusing on supply strategy
Help the supply business and tech teams learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams’ strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product and operational development and evaluation.


Who You Are


8+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Ability to collaborate with multiple teams to drive strategic decisions and execute on them
Strong project management skills
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity and reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem-solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d) Pricing
Description:
DocMorris steht für kundenorientierte innovative Dienstleistungen und eine große Produktvielfalt rund um die digitale Gesundheitsversorgung. Sie reichen von der schnellen Terminvereinbarung für den Online-Arztbesuch auf der Telemedizin-Plattform von TeleClinic bis zur pharmazeutischen Beratung und Versorgung mit verschreibungspflichtigen und rezeptfreien Medikamenten sowie Gesundheitsprodukten aus Deutschlands bekanntester Online-Apotheke.

Hinzu kommt der Marktplatz mit einem breiten ergänzenden Sortiment von Heil- und Hilfsmitteln sowie Produkten aus den Bereichen Ernährung, Beauty und Familie. Damit schafft DocMorris für ihre Kundinnen und Kunden einen einfachen Zugang zu umfassenden Gesundheitsdienstleistungen an einem Ort mit nur einem Klick. Im Segment Deutschland erwirtschaftete die Schweizer DocMorris AG im Jahr 2023 mit über 9 Millionen aktiven Kundinnen und Kunden einen Außenumsatz von 976 Millionen CHF.

Aufgaben


Du entwickelst Reportings und erstellst Ad-hoc-Analysen zur Umsatz-, Margen- und Preisentwicklung sowie zum Erfolg unserer Promotions.
Auf dieser Basis erarbeitest Du Handlungsempfehlungen für strategische und taktische Pricing-Entscheidungen. Damit trägst Du maßgeblich zum Geschäftserfolg unserer Produkte im Bereich der freiverkäuflichen Arzneimittel bei.
Du entwickelst unsere Pricing-Prozesse weiter und wirkst mit bei der Optimierung unserer Pricing-Algorithmen. Dabei wendest Du auch komplexe Analysemethoden an.
Du arbeitest eng mit den Bereichen Online-Marketing, Category Management, Supply-Chain-Management und Einkauf sowie unserem Data-Team zusammen.



Qualifikation


Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium in Mathematik, Statistik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder Betriebswirtschaftslehre.
Ein kommerzielles Verständnis im Bereich E-Commerce, idealerweise im Bereich Pricing, rundet Dein Profil ab.
Du hast Kenntnisse im Umgang mit relationalen Datenbanken, hast bereits mit SQL gearbeitet und besitzt Erfahrungen mit BI- und Visualisierungstools (z.B. Tableau, Power BI, QlikView oder anderen).
Idealerweise hast Du bereits statistische Analysemethoden angewendet und mit gängigen Statistiksoftwarepaketen gearbeitet.
Du hast ausgeprägte analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten.
Du sprichst gutes Deutsch und gutes Englisch.



Benefits


Attraktive Vergünstigungen in diversen Shops über Corporate Benefits
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge mit attraktiven Arbeitgeberzuschüssen
30 Urlaubstage
Möglichkeit zur Teilnahme am Mitarbeiterbeteiligungsprogramm (Aktienoptionen)
Zugang zu eLearning-Plattformen wie LinkedIn Learning
Fairer Lohn für Festangestellte und Zeitarbeitnehmer sowie angemessene Vergütung von Praktika
Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und regelmäßige Entwicklungsgespräche
Tolle Mitarbeiter-Events und jährliche Firmenfeiern
Wohlfühl-Arbeitsumgebung mit klimatisierten, hellen Büros. Ergonomisch eingerichtete Arbeitsplätze mit hochmoderner technischer Ausstattung.
Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle und Homeoffice-Möglichkeiten
Gute Anbindung an den öffentlichen Nahverkehr



Gestalte mit uns das neue Gesund! Wir freuen uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung!

Bei Fragen steht Dir Matthias Wegerle unter der Telefonnummer +49 (0)621 397316 654 gerne zur Verfügung.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







Apply Online Today!

Show more
