Title: Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie’s Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

The role is for someone who is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable to work on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, is able to document effectively.

This is a unique opportunity for analysts who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of fintech business, develop additional muscles, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

Responsibilities


Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
Support product segments in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy
Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
Create, maintain and update dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
Enhance data processes, identify gaps, and streamline data collection
Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie’s portfolio
Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who We Are Looking For


You have 5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
Proficiency in data and analytics concepts, tools, and methodologies
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Able to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
You had the chance to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-starter, well organized, good planner, able to work independently and meet deadlines
Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Challenging and impactful work that drives personal and professional growth
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
A hybrid working approach that allows you to work from home for up to 3 days per week
Enjoy 30 days vacation per year on top of paid public holidays, sabbatical opportunities, and extra child sickness leave for parents
Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, the Billie run club, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!
Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more


Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.
Show more

Title: (Junior) Data Consultant (m/w/d)
Description:
Die Position

Wir suchen eine/n (Junior) Data Consultant (m/w/d) zur Verstärkung unseres Data Teams bei Project A.

In deiner täglichen Arbeit fokussierst Du dich auf die Identifizierung von Daten, die zu Wachstum und Effizienz bei unseren Kunden beitragen können. In Zusammenarbeit mit unserem Data Engineering- und Science Team hilfst Du dabei, diese Möglichkeiten zu nutzen. Dabei konzentrierst du dich auf die tatsächliche Wirkung und nicht auf den Einsatz neuer Technologien oder Methoden und erhältst gleichzeitig einzigartige Einblicke in das Arbeitsumfeld eines der führenden Venture Capital in Europa.

Unser Data Team ist der festen Überzeugung, dass das Jahrzehnt der Daten begonnen hat: Durch die Arbeit mit über 70 Kunden haben wir gelernt, wie man Rohdaten in echte Erkenntnisse, Produkte, Funktionen und mehr verwandelt.

Jetzt liegt es an dir, diese Daten zu nutzen, um durch aufschlussreiche Visualisierungen, bemerkenswerte Analysen und aussagekräftige Stakeholder-Beziehungen ein tatsächliches Geschäftswachstum zu erzielen.

Motivation, Kreativität und Offenheit prägen unsere Werte und Kultur. Deshalb ermutigen wir dich, sich eigenständig in deine Arbeit einzubringen. Werde Teil eines multinationalen Teams von klugen Köpfen und lass dich inspirieren, zu wachsen, innovativ zu sein und von Anfang an Verantwortung zu übernehmen.

Sei verantwortlich für:


Beratung unserer Kunden, Daten sinnvoll zu nutzen und datengesteuerte Entscheidungen zu fördern
Proaktives Erkennen und Umsetzen relevanter Datenprojekte für unsere Kunden - hinsichtlich ihrer strategischen- und Investitionsziele
Projekte mit Teammitgliedern vorantreiben und in Unternehmen reales Wachstum fördern
Aufbau von nachhaltigen Beziehungen zu Stakeholdern aus diversen Unternehmen und Industrien
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit dem Data Engineering & Science-Team bei dem Management von Data Warehousing und Machine Learning Projekten
Daten Tracking und Erfassung mit verschiedenen client- und server gestützten Lösungen



Dein Profil


1-2 Jahre Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data Consulting - idealerweise in einem leistungsstarken und dynamischen Umfeld, wobei ein Hintergrund in der Beratung oder in einer Agentur von Vorteil ist
Hohes Maß an emotionaler Intelligenz, um nachhaltige Beziehungen zu (leitenden) Interessengruppen aufzubauen und zu pflegen
Erste Erfahrung in mindestens einem speziellen Datenbereich (z.B. Marketing Analytics, Product Analytics, Data Governance, Customer Analytics) ist von Vorteil
Bereits Umgang mit Tools zur Datenanalyse und -modellierung, inkl. SQL / dbt
Erste Kenntnisse im Bereich MDS: Datenerfassung (Google Tag Manager, Segment), Datenintegration (Fivetran, Airbyte), Datenbanken (Snowflake, BigQuery), Datenmodellierung (dbt, DataForm) & Aktivierung (Looker, Metabase, PowerBI, Census)
Fließend in Deutsch und Englisch ist ein Muss



Bitte beachte, dass wir Unterstützung in unserem Berliner Büro suchen. Die Berechtigung, innerhalb der EU zu arbeiten, ist ebenfalls erforderlich.

Wie wir in deinen Erfolg investieren:


Gestalte die Zukunft: Übernimm die Leitung bei spannenden Projekten, egal ob aufstrebendes oder führendes Unternehmen in Europa und Großbritannien.
Arbeite Seite an Seite mit Experten: Profitiere von einem Team aus hoch motivierten Kollegen, die diverse Erfahrung aus internationalen Backgrounds mitbringen und Ihr Wissen mit dir teilen. Für deinen maximalen Lerneffekt.
Gib deiner Karriere einen Boost: Mit abwechslungsreichen Projekten und maßgeschneiderten Trainings statten wir dich mit allem aus, was du für deinen nächsten Karriereschritt brauchst.
Strebe nach Fortschritt: Hast du eine spannende Idee oder ein neues Tool im Blick? Lass es uns ausprobieren! Mit unserem großzügigen F&E-Budget hast du die Freiheit, neue Technologien auszuprobieren und unsere Prozesse zu verbessern.
Wachse durch Zusammenarbeit: Knüpfe wertvolle Kontakte bei regelmäßigen Events und tausche dich in dynamischen Netzwerken aus – für dein persönliches und unser gemeinsames Wachstum.
Übernimm Verantwortung Strebe nach Fortschritt: Wir stellen dir die Tools und Strukturen zur Verfügung, die du benötigst. Dafür ermutigen wir dich, deine Kreativität einzusetzen und schätzen dabei Autonomie bei der Umsetzung deiner Projekte.



Wir engagieren uns für Diversität und Inklusion

Project A bekennt sich zu Diversität und Chancengleichheit, dies gilt gleichermaßen für unsere Mitarbeitenden als auch Kandidat:Innen.

Wir schätzen die Menschen – mit all ihren herrlichen, vielfältigen Hintergründen, Perspektiven und Erfahrungen. Unser vielfältiges Team hat unterschiedliche ethnische und kulturelle Hintergründe, geschlechtliche Identitäten, sexuelle Orientierungen, Familienverhältnisse, religiöse und politische Zugehörigkeiten, sozioökonomische Status, Altersgruppen und Fähigkeiten. Mit 32 Nationalitäten und über 25 gesprochenen Sprachen sind wir sicher, dass du dich bei uns wie zu Hause fühlen wirst. Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Size & Fit (all genders)
Description:
As a Senior Data Analyst for Size & Fit , you will play a key role in addressing the challenge of finding the right fit in online shopping.

Size and Fit works towards solving the customer problem of not being able to find the right fit in online shopping. Our mission involves gaining a deep understanding of customers’ preferences related to size and fit, as well as a comprehensive knowledge of the assortment attributes and measurements from our brands. The real magic happens when we successfully match both.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with the Size and Fit team, which includes members from Product Management, Analytics, Applied Science, and Engineering. You will act as a bridge to the commercial team. You will measure and analyze how the solutions we provide to our customers are impacting our business and your insights will enable strategic commercial decisions at Zalando.


INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN


At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups


WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)




Bring the business data-driven analytical approach to the Size & Fit Team; you generate hypotheses and try to test them by performing descriptive, exploratory and quantitative analyses. You can translate data into actionable insights for the business. You know when a hypothesis can only be tested by an experiment, and you can help create and drive them.
You are the connector between the Product and the Business. You can translate the Size and Fit benefits to answer complex business questions and identify and measure commercial opportunities.
Be a reliable partner for the Size & Fit Team when related to commercial reporting and analytics, and support the Team with more complex analysis.
Avoid working in silos by collaborating with cross-functional leaders from Applied Science, Product, Content and Customer Analytics to drive innovation. You incorporate data from different sources within and outside of Zalando to drive projects.




WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF




Proven track record of 5+ experience in analytics A university degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Quantitative social science, or a comparable subject.
Strong technical background with advanced SQL skills and programming background (e.g. Python, R, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks). Excellent knowledge in coding for data retrieval, exploration and analysis. Advanced statistical skills such as A/B testing and causal inference. Constant drive and tenacity to learn new techniques and tools are a must.
Understanding of the economics of online platforms and/or online fashion retailers, as well as the commercial KPIs governing their success.
Effective communication to convince any audience with the insights you generate and compelling storytelling in any form that enables decision-making.
Enjoy working cross-functionally; you have great stakeholder management skills to work with different levels of management to support, challenge and bring solutions.
Hands-on mentality, a person who always finds solutions to challenges. You are proactive, can adapt quickly to changes and always remain focused on our quality objectives.




OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits; here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counselling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching are available



Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us

Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.





Qualification Path

Title: Senior Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Help Experience
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 20+ markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

As a Decision Scientist in our Help Experience domain, you’ll play a key role in enhancing the support experience for our Vinted members. This role will be embedded in a new cross-functional product team within the domain, where you will take the lead in driving experimentation. You will collaborate closely with your team to deliver impactful, data-informed decisions that improve quality, scalability, and efficiency in support operations through automation, self-service, and operational excellence.

We’re looking for someone who is a strategic thinker, a problem solver, with a strong data background, who aims high. You like to work in a fast-changing environment, and you are passionate about the product we’re building together.

Next to the product team you will be part of the cross-domain Data Science & Analytics (DSA) guild where you will interact and learn from all data people in Vinted. Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:


Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.
Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.
Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.


You will report to the Director of Data Science & Analytics in Help Experience and work closely with other leaders in the domain, particularly in the data science & analytics and product functions.

In this position, you’ll


Collaborate with your team and direct stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities and answer key business questions
Ensure these questions are answered in an optimal fashion (e.g. in the form of an ad hoc deep-dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis)
Analyse identified opportunities to understand their scope and impact (i.e. size opportunities)
Own the key performance indicators for a team, including selection, tracking, forecasting, and proactively flagging issues
Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-serving and dashboarding tools (Looker)
Define the requirements for (A/B) testing and analyze the results of (A/B) tests
Help to create a backlog with prioritized hypotheses and analyses


About You


Demonstratable experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, Product Analyst
BSc or MSc in Applied Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Econometrics, or another related field (equivalent working experience is also acceptable)
Highly business-oriented and comfortable with iterative processes
A good communicator who can present complex topics clearly and persuasively to different audiences
Excellent written and spoken English
Are able to balance between analyses depth (time needed) and business impact
Ability to deal with uncertainty and to combine data insights with strategic thinking
Statistical proficiency (e.g. A/B testing, regression analysis)
Advanced knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (Python, R, etc.)
Fluency with SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

We invest in your professional growth! As part of our commitment to continuous learning, we offer an annual learning budget to support your personal and career development through courses, certifications, workshops and more.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The base salary range for this position is €69,000 - €90,000 gross per year.

Title: Senior Growth Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
The role

As a Growth Data Analyst in the Growth Analytics team, you will join the wider International Marketing Analytics group which acts as a key consultant for the International part of HelloFresh business. Your main focus will be on supporting your Growth stakeholders in their decision making, and you will be their key contact person regarding data and analytics questions. Your experience with Growth analytics and related technologies, together with your excellent communication, stakeholder management and organizational skills will have a big impact on the company’s performance.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you don’t “tick all the boxes” but think you’d thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What You’ll Do


Provide cracking insights to optimize marketing campaigns and channel targeting and efficiency
Translate business questions into meaningful analytics for your stakeholders via multiple Growth channels
Creating ad-hoc insights, Lift Tests, AB test analyses, reporting & visualization
Utilise various databases and querying/programming languages to access, manipulate and present the data needed
Improve how we look at Growth Analytics as a group, bringing key analytical insight to various levels across the organization
You will not only take responsibility of own projects, but also be a team player to collaborate and share knowledge with other analysts


What You’ll Bring


Proven experience in Growth Marketing Analytics or any of the following domains: Data Analytics/Business Analytics/Marketing Analytics/Product Analytics/Data Science
5+ years of experience in data analytics and statistical modelling
A degree in Analytics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline
Preferably experience in working with web analytics (Google Analytics, Meta AA, ADH etc.)
Preferably experience with growth marketing analytics and testing (lift tests, campaign analytics, channel efficiency, AB testing)
Expertise in SQL, Python & bigquery with excitement to learn more on the technical side!
Expertise in building dashboards, we use Tableau
Experience in statistical modeling, regression, clustering, time series etc is good to have
Any team management experience, mentoring or managing 1-2 analyst is good to have
Experience in performing analysis with large datasets and knowing what the common pitfalls are
Marketing or product related experience is good, not a must
Analytical and critical thinking combined with good presentation and communication skills
Strong problems solving skills and hands-on & can-do attitude
Ability to work independently


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Comprehensive relocation assistance to move to Berlin plus visa application support (if applicable)
A significant discount on your weekly HelloFresh box
Internal learning and development opportunities with the HelloFresh Academy
Mental health support, including Headspace subscription and access to qualified therapists through Spill
Monthly transportation budget through Rydes app
Working parents support
Additional perks include: Annual German language budget, discounts for John Reed gyms & Urban Sports Club, regular company events, fresh fruit & free drinks in the office, in-house yoga classes, monthly discount on the Convini vending machine in the office
Hybrid working model (option to work from home for up to 2 days per week if preferred)
Sabbatical leave option after 18 months of being with HelloFresh
HelloFresh Pension Scheme that is subsidized with 20% on top
A diverse and vibrant international environment of 90+ different nationalities
The chance to have a significant impact on one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe in an exciting growth phase


Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

JR100987

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Product Analytics (m/w/d)
Description:
FIXING THE PLANET BY MAKING HOMES CARBON-FREE!

With €35 million in funding from top-tier investors such as COATUE, Foundamental & Target Global, we are working towards a future where climate-neutral buildings - simply & rapidly - become a reality. At Enter, we aggregate and analyze relevant building data so that homeowners can sustainably reduce their energy costs and increase the value of their property.

We believe in:


Common code access
No gatekeepers
Simplicity over industry standards
Embracing the small change
Each API is a product
Baked in quality



We’re looking for people with an entrepreneurial mindset who enjoy having the freedom to directly own and impact parts of the Enter product.

Deine Aufgaben


Create and maintain the product analytics dashboards and related KPIs, ensuring alignment with contract compliance and minimizing incidents.
Manage the lifecycle of all data products in our visualization tool Metabase, including decommissioning unused dashboards, aiming for less than 5% unused dashboards weekly.
Increase the weekly usage of Metabase to 80% within your crew.
Ensure the Metabase structure is organized and easy to navigate.
Take responsibility for the correctness of data, regardless of the origin of any issues.
Be a key resource for team members to improve their ability to read and interpret data effectively.



Dein Profil


You have extensive experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role, maintaining dashboards and KPIs (5+ years of experience)
You have advanced proficiency in managing data products in Metabase or similar platforms.
Experience with Product Analytic tools like Amplitude and Event based reportings is a plus.
You have a strong understanding of data lifecycle management, including cleaning up and decommissioning unused assets.
You have analytical skills and pay attention to detail, with a focus on data accuracy and quality.
You have excellent communication and collaboration skills to support crew leads and team members in understanding and using data.
You have the ability to combine technical data expertise with domain-specific knowledge.
You are fluent in English (German is a plus, but not required).



Benefits


Become part of one of Europe's fastest growing Climate Tech Startups - funded by Europe's best known VC's.
Attractive & competitive compensation.
Work with top talent in a dynamic environment.
Individual benefits: learning budget, Urban Sports Clubs membership, job ticket or daycare allowance.
Office with a direct view of the Spree River, with everything your heart desires.
Numerous team events, including weekly yoga.

Show more

Title: (Data) Supply Analytics Manager (m / f / d )
Description:
Company Description

Omio’s vision is to enable people to travel seamlessly anywhere, anyway. We are bringing all global transport into a single distribution system and creating end-to-end magical consumer journeys.

With Omio you can compare and book trains, buses, ferries and flights anywhere in Europe, the US, and Canada with one simple search, on mobile, app or desktop. By offering transparent pricing and easy booking, Omio makes travel planning simple, flexible and personal.

Omio is the largest source of inventory, with 1000+ suppliers operating in 39 countries. Our brands also include Rome2Rio for global discovery, while Omio powers ticketing and journeys, which attract 900m+ users every year. Our offices are based in Berlin, Prague, Melbourne, Brazil, Bangalore, and London.

We are a growing team of more than 400 passionate employees from more than 50 countries who share the same vision: to create a single tool to help send travellers almost anywhere in the world.

Job Description

Job Description

Omio is rapidly expanding its product offerings across all of its markets and is looking to grow its capabilities and improve the efficiency of how we enable the use of data to drive fast, accurate decision-making across the business.

We are working through a major change programme designed to evolve the use of data across the organisation, focussing on quality and accessibility, and taking a product-led approach.

As a part of this change, we are building a new function dedicated to supporting our supply of travel inventory. This is a role offering huge variety, onboarding, and monitoring our suppliers through the whole lifecycle, ensuring we are best using their inventory and working with finance to ensure the correct allocation of commissions and invoicing.

The role also takes responsibility for zooming out from suppliers and looking across whole modes (e.g. trains, buses, ferries) and geographies (initially European countries only).

Key Responsibilities


Understand Omio’s business model, particularly around the supply of travel inventory across the globe.
Define and adopt efficient automation around supplier onboarding, performance measurement and financial reconciliation.
Understand and lead on establishing Omio’s top-line metrics and KPIs, reporting their evolution, detecting anomalies, evaluating key drivers, and diagnosing issue root causes.
Build forecasting models to understand gaps in current performance and sales/revenue optimization models to enhance margins without negatively impacting user experience
Perform statistical analyses - including A/B tests and pre/post analyses
Correlate marketing/product/commercial data to derive key insights
Work with our data engineering/business intelligence teams to build data models, which best summarise and utilise our production data
Act as an advocate of our company’s data-driven culture: produce reports that are actionable, dashboards that are diagnostic, and recommendations that drive growth


Qualifications

A successful candidate will be:


Passionate about continuous improvement.
An excellent stakeholder manager with great communication and presentation skills.
Enthusiastic, with a sense of pride in the work delivered and the quality of how it was delivered.
An open and honest individual who both welcomes and provides feedback in a way that is constructive and thoughtful.
Highly collaborative with fantastic facilitation skills at team and department level.
Comfortable with flexibility, ambiguity and changing priorities.
Value and outcome-driven, with a positive “can-do” attitude.


A Successful Candidate Will Have


Minimum 5 years of experience as a product or data analyst, ideally in the tech start-up/scale-up environment.
Ideally some experience of B2B or B2B2C environments.
Experience in working with European travel providers would be a significant advantage.
Experience of line management, leading and developing a small team.
Strong analytical thinking with a structured approach to problem-solving.
Experienced in using SQL extensively.
Strong communication skills and a proven track record of collaborating effectively within cross-functional teams
Strong business intuition and a data-driven mindset to drive impactful solutions that meet strategic objectives. Communicate complex insights clearly and collaborate seamlessly with senior management to support decision-making
Bonus points if you have:
GCP, BigQuery, Looker, Python, Spark

Additional Information

What’s in it for you?


Have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, we are changing the way people travel, and you too can have an impact on this ride
A competitive and attractive compensation package
Subsidized Urban Sports Club membership
A diverse team of more than 45 nationalities


Diversity makes us stronger

We value diversity and welcome all applicants regardless of ethnicity, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age or disability.

Hiring process and background checks

At Omio, we work in partnership with Giant Screening, once a job offer has been accepted, Giant will be engaged to carry out background screening. Giant will reach out to you via email and occasionally via telephone/text message so that they can gather all the relevant information required. Consent will be requested prior to any information being passed to our services company.

Recruitment scams: Important notice

Protect yourself from scammers, Omio wants to ensure your ongoing safety during the application process at Omio. Please keep in mind potential scammers impersonating Omio recruiters (mainly via a global professional networking site, and messenger app's).

Remember, Omio never requests payment or sensitive personal information during the recruitment process. All official job opportunities are exclusively posted on our careers page. If you suspect fraudulent activity, report it to recruitment@omio.com. Remember to cross-reference against our careers page if you question the authenticity, stay vigilant, and protect yourself from recruitment scams.

Intrigued? Apply here in English.
Show more
HTML:
Company Description

Omio’s vision is to enable people to travel seamlessly anywhere, anyway. We are bringing all global transport into a single distribution system and creating end-to-end magical consumer journeys.

With Omio you can compare and book trains, buses, ferries and flights anywhere in Europe, the US, and Canada with one simple search, on mobile, app or desktop. By offering transparent pricing and easy booking, Omio makes travel planning simple, flexible and personal.

Omio is the largest source of inventory, with 1000+ suppliers operating in 39 countries. Our brands also include Rome2Rio for global discovery, while Omio powers ticketing and journeys, which attract 900m+ users every year. Our offices are based in Berlin, Prague, Melbourne, Brazil, Bangalore, and London.

We are a growing team of more than 400 passionate employees from more than 50 countries who share the same vision: to create a single tool to help send travellers almost anywhere in the world.

Job Description

Job Description

Omio is rapidly expanding its product offerings across all of its markets and is looking to grow its capabilities and improve the efficiency of how we enable the use of data to drive fast, accurate decision-making across the business.

We are working through a major change programme designed to evolve the use of data across the organisation, focussing on quality and accessibility, and taking a product-led approach.

As a part of this change, we are building a new function dedicated to supporting our supply of travel inventory. This is a role offering huge variety, onboarding, and monitoring our suppliers through the whole lifecycle, ensuring we are best using their inventory and working with finance to ensure the correct allocation of commissions and invoicing.

The role also takes responsibility for zooming out from suppliers and looking across whole modes (e.g. trains, buses, ferries) and geographies (initially European countries only).

Key Responsibilities

  • Understand Omio’s business model, particularly around the supply of travel inventory across the globe.
  • Define and adopt efficient automation around supplier onboarding, performance measurement and financial reconciliation.
  • Understand and lead on establishing Omio’s top-line metrics and KPIs, reporting their evolution, detecting anomalies, evaluating key drivers, and diagnosing issue root causes.
  • Build forecasting models to understand gaps in current performance and sales/revenue optimization models to enhance margins without negatively impacting user experience
  • Perform statistical analyses - including A/B tests and pre/post analyses
  • Correlate marketing/product/commercial data to derive key insights
  • Work with our data engineering/business intelligence teams to build data models, which best summarise and utilise our production data
  • Act as an advocate of our company’s data-driven culture: produce reports that are actionable, dashboards that are diagnostic, and recommendations that drive growth

Qualifications

A successful candidate will be:

  • Passionate about continuous improvement.
  • An excellent stakeholder manager with great communication and presentation skills.
  • Enthusiastic, with a sense of pride in the work delivered and the quality of how it was delivered.
  • An open and honest individual who both welcomes and provides feedback in a way that is constructive and thoughtful.
  • Highly collaborative with fantastic facilitation skills at team and department level.
  • Comfortable with flexibility, ambiguity and changing priorities.
  • Value and outcome-driven, with a positive “can-do” attitude.

A Successful Candidate Will Have

  • Minimum 5 years of experience as a product or data analyst, ideally in the tech start-up/scale-up environment.
  • Ideally some experience of B2B or B2B2C environments.
  • Experience in working with European travel providers would be a significant advantage.
  • Experience of line management, leading and developing a small team.
  • Strong analytical thinking with a structured approach to problem-solving.
  • Experienced in using SQL extensively.
  • Strong communication skills and a proven track record of collaborating effectively within cross-functional teams
  • Strong business intuition and a data-driven mindset to drive impactful solutions that meet strategic objectives. Communicate complex insights clearly and collaborate seamlessly with senior management to support decision-making
  • Bonus points if you have:
    • GCP, BigQuery, Looker, Python, Spark
Additional Information

What’s in it for you?

  • Have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, we are changing the way people travel, and you too can have an impact on this ride
  • A competitive and attractive compensation package
  • Subsidized Urban Sports Club membership
  • A diverse team of more than 45 nationalities

Diversity makes us stronger

We value diversity and welcome all applicants regardless of ethnicity, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age or disability.

Hiring process and background checks

At Omio, we work in partnership with Giant Screening, once a job offer has been accepted, Giant will be engaged to carry out background screening. Giant will reach out to you via email and occasionally via telephone/text message so that they can gather all the relevant information required. Consent will be requested prior to any information being passed to our services company.

Recruitment scams: Important notice

Protect yourself from scammers, Omio wants to ensure your ongoing safety during the application process at Omio. Please keep in mind potential scammers impersonating Omio recruiters (mainly via a global professional networking site, and messenger app's).

Remember, Omio never requests payment or sensitive personal information during the recruitment process. All official job opportunities are exclusively posted on our careers page. If you suspect fraudulent activity, report it to recruitment@omio.com. Remember to cross-reference against our careers page if you question the authenticity, stay vigilant, and protect yourself from recruitment scams.

Intrigued? Apply here in English.

Title: Data Analyst Valuation (m/w/d)
Description:
GEMEINSAM ERFOLGREICH

Sie suchen eine neue Herausforderung? Sie möchten Ihre Karriere in eine neue Richtung lenken? Sie möchten etwas bewegen?

Unser Data Intelligence & Digital Enablement Team in Deutschland schafft durch den Einsatz von Daten, Technologien und innovativen Lösungen echten Mehrwert für unser Business. Wir treiben die digitale Transformation des Unternehmens voran, managen zentrale Enterprise Applikationen und unterstützen unsere operativen Business- und Research-Teams bei der Erweiterung, Pflege, Konsolidierung, Analyse und Visualisierung einer einzigartigen Immobiliendatenlandschaft.

Für unser Team suchen wir ab sofort einen Data Analyst Valuation (m/w/d) in Berlin, Hamburg oder Frankfurt am Main.

IMMOBILIEN – WIR MACHEN DAS

CBRE ist – in Bezug auf den Umsatz im Geschäftsjahr 2023 – der größte globale Immobiliendienstleister. Mit mehr als 130.000 Mitarbeitern in über 100 Ländern steht CBRE Investoren und Immobiliennutzern als Partner für alle Immobilienbelange weltweit zur Seite. Wir bieten unseren Kunden ein breites Spektrum an integrierten Leistungen aus einer Hand – über den gesamten Lebenszyklus einer Immobilie hinweg.

DAS MACHEN SIE BEI UNS


(Weiter-)Entwicklung und Verwaltung zentraler Business Intelligence (BI) Produkte für den Geschäftsbereich Valuation Advisory Services
Bearbeitung der hoch priorisierten neuen Anwendungsfälle aus dem Anforderungskatalog der Bewertungsplattform mithilfe von Datenbankabfragen und BI Tools, in enger Abstimmung mit dem Data Engineering Team
Migration bestehender automatisierter Reports und Dashboards von der deutschen Legacy-Plattform (PostgreSQL) in die neue CBRE Continental Europe Data Platform (Snowflake)
Überprüfung und gegebenenfalls Neuentwicklung existierender Datenmanagement-Prozesse sowie Optimierung der Dateninfrastruktur
Dokumentation bestehender und zukünftiger datenbezogener Anwendungsfälle, insbesondere hinsichtlich der automatischen Befüllung der Kalkulationsmodelle
Erstellung eines Datenkatalogs inklusive Data Lineage und Business Glossary
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Continental Europe Data Teams zur Anpassung regionaler Tools an den lokalen Kontext
Selbstständige und proaktive Weiterbildung sowie Recherche zu relevanten Themen der Immobilienbewertung unter Nutzung interner und externer Ressourcen


DAS HABEN SIE ZU BIETEN


Erfolgreicher Bachelor-Abschluss in Immobilienwirtschaft, Betriebswirtschaft, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder vergleichbaren Studiengängen
Fachkenntnisse und/oder Praxiserfahrung in der Immobilienwirtschaft oder Finanzbranche mit Fokus auf agiles IT Project Management
Idealerweise erste praktische Erfahrungen im Kontext von Dokumentenmanagement und KI
Grundkenntnisse in der Nutzung von Projektmanagement Tools (z.B. Smartsheet, Monday, MS Project, Jira, Azure DevOps) sind von Vorteil
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in MS Office365 (Excel, Powerpoint, Teams, OneNote)
Hervorragende schriftliche und verbale Kommunikationsfähigkeit auf Deutsch und Englisch; sehr gute organisatorische und analytische Fähigkeiten; effiziente und verlässliche Arbeitsweise; gute Präsentationsfähigkeit


DAS BIETEN WIR IHNEN


Wir machen flexibles und mobiles Arbeiten möglich: Egal ob im Büro, zu Hause, unterwegs oder während einer Workation
Werden Sie Teil des einzigartigen CBRE-Spirits und profitieren Sie von schnellen Entscheidungswegen und Duz-Kultur
Bleiben Sie mobil mit unserem Fahrtkostenzuschuss zum ÖPNV
Durch das offene high-end Bürokonzept leben wir täglich unsere Unternehmenskultur auf Augenhöhe
Erfolge zusammen feiern! Dafür gibt es Gelegenheit bei regelmäßigen Team-Events
Profitieren Sie von weiteren Benefits wie Familienservice, Corporate Benefits, Betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Sonderkonditionen für Fitnessstudios, JobRad u.v.m


MACHEN SIE MIT?

Werden Sie Teil unserer Erfolgsgeschichte! - Wir freuen uns über Ihre Bewerbung über unser Online-Bewerbungssystem, inklusive Lebenslauf, Anschreiben und relevanten Zeugnissen.

Bitte beachten Sie, dass wir aus Datenschutzgründen leider keine Bewerbungen per E-Mail annehmen können.

Bei Rückfragen zur Stellenanzeige wenden Sie sich gerne per E-Mail an unser Talent Acquisition Team: bewerbung@cbre.com


Show more

Title: Working Student Data Analytics (f/m/d)
Description:
Upvest, founded in 2017, enables any financial institution to offer great investment experiences to its customers. Upvest is an investment firm regulated by the German supervision authority (BaFin). The company currently employs 160+ people across Europe with its headquarters based in Berlin, Germany.

The company is backed by the world’s largest venture capital funds and investors including Bessemer Venture Partners, BlackRock, Earlybird, HV Capital, Notion Capital, and ABN Amro Ventures, as well as by renowned fintech entrepreneurs (including Maximilian Tayenthal, founder of N26, and Felix Haas, founder of IDnow).

We’re looking for fintech enthusiasts to join us in creating the financial infrastructure of tomorrow. We’re building the first European Investment API to enable any financial institution offering a wide range of efficient and transparent investment products, such as stocks and ETFs in nominal, portfolio, and fractional form. Our mission and vision is to make investing as easy as spending money.

We’re based in Berlin but are also open to hiring remotely in Germany or Estonia for this role. If you're currently based elsewhere but would like to move to Germany, we’re happy to support your relocation.

Your Mission

At Upvest, you'll become an integral part of our Data Management community where Analysts, and Engineers collaborate to learn and grow together. Moreover, our integrated organisational structure provides you with the opportunity to work closely across finance, product, engineering, finance, and operations areas.

This Role Will Give You The Opportunity To


Data Analysis and Insights: Dive into complex datasets to extract valuable insights and trends that drive data-informed decisions, ensuring our B2B offerings are optimised for success.
Client Data Analysis & Customised Reporting: You'll conduct in-depth analysis of client data to provide actionable insights and create custom reports and data visualisations tailored to our B2B clients' specific needs, enabling them to make informed decisions and gain a competitive edge.
Data Architecture and Tools: Collaborate on data architecture projects with a primary focus on achieving 100% data consistency. Utilise advanced tools such as DBT, BigQuery, and Looker, prioritising data quality and integrity in all data modelling and analysis tasks. This approach enhances our ability to meet client needs by ensuring consistent and reliable data.
Cross-Functional Impact: Collaborate with various teams, including developers and product managers, to seamlessly integrate your data-driven insights into our B2B products and services, driving continuous improvement.
Data Strategy Implementation and Product Enhancement: Play a pivotal role in executing our data strategy, ensuring that data-driven solutions are seamlessly integrated into our B2B offerings, and work to enhance our financial APIs and services based on data-driven insights that meet our clients' evolving needs. Additionally, actively support the initiative to transform our data into a standalone product, leveraging your analytical skills to develop valuable insights and features that can be marketed and sold to a wider audience, thus expanding our revenue streams and market presence


Job Requirements


Data-Driven Impact: You will play a crucial role in our data analytics team, contributing to data collection, cleaning, and analysis. By developing analytical models, interpreting trends, and presenting your findings, you will help shape our business intelligence solutions and drive our data capabilities forward.
Variety of Data Challenges: You'll face a diverse range of data tasks, working with various data sources. Your role will involve creating comprehensive dashboards, tackling data mining and analysis projects. Regular team discussions will provide opportunities to present your innovative solutions, fostering a collaborative environment focused on excellence and continuous improvement in data analysis.
Collaboration: Expect a collaborative environment where you'll work closely with talented professionals across different teams, including developers, product managers, and financial experts. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do.
Continuous Learning: You'll enjoy ongoing opportunities for professional development. We provide comprehensive training programs, workshops, and resources to enhance your data analysis skills and keep you at the forefront of industry trends.
An experienced team and culture driven organisation: Despite the early stage of the company, we have assembled a world-class team with lots of experience across all key domains that we require for our success, from banking and risk to regulatory, legal and compliance to product and engineering. The organisation is also full of people who have successfully scaled companies before, who understand the importance of live and breath culture and “people first”.


Minimum Requirements


Graduate or current master's student in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or related fields, with at least 2 semesters completed.
Ability to understand technical information quickly, derive insights, and devise solutions.
Ideally, you have already gained practical experience in conducting quantitative analysis (e. g. experience abroad, internships) and are interested in financial data
Familiarity with statistical techniques, data visualisation, and database management is advantageous.
Experience with Business Intelligence (BI) tools such as Looker or PowerBI.
You have good knowledge of SQL and Python (PySpark, pandas, scikit-learn) or other programming languages
A self starter with a strong sense of ownership for your work and an ability to iterate quickly
A team player who is excited about working with a diverse range of colleagues
Fluent in English, both written and spoken
Based in Berlin (where our office is located) to experience the unique team culture at Upvest
Eligibility to work in Germany


Why Upvest?


Greenfield projects. We’re building something quite complex and a first in Europe. This means we’re working with cutting-edge technologies and with no legacy code.
Wellbeing. At Upvest, everyone has access to our in-house coach where you can have regular sessions to support you personally and professionally.
Development. In keeping with one of our core values, ‘Learn and Grow’, every Upvenger has access to a development budget. In line with one of our other values, ‘Own the Outcome’, how you choose to make the most of it, is up to you.
Flexibility. We work in a hybrid setup with the team distributed around Germany and Europe. We give you the choice (and budget) to spend your time where you are most comfortable and productive, either at home or the office. You choose.


Our Values


Learn and grow. We aim high to shape our future. We give and request honest feedback knowing that we develop together. Progression over Perfection.
Team first. We make it easy for others. We value our differences and are open to others' opinions. We win and celebrate together! Team over Egos.
Own the outcome. Whether we win or we lose, we stand together. We are proactive and get the job done. Outcome over Process.
Tell the story. We always start with the why. We share knowledge to empower others. Transparency over Complexity.


Upvest is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees

Title: Open Application
Description:
Founded in 2020, Y42 is a fast-growing company of70+ambitious and dedicated experts from all over the world who are on a mission to reshape the data space. We are backed by some of the world’s most renowned investors, having raised $34m in funding (Series A + seed round). This enabled us to build one of the largest tech and product teams across all European Series A-funded startups with 50+team members.

We work together to create an environment for people with open minds who want to grow and have an impact. Being a part of Y42 means constant growth and opportunity. We are all highly ambitious yet united in our mission to succeed as a team. Here, you can truly explore and redefine your own potential. We believe it is crucial for everyone here to find purpose in what they do, thrive, and feel like they belong. That is why we invite you to

Joining Y42 means joining our mission and contributing to our growth. A lot of what we are doing is unexplored, which means that you will find yourself doing things you haven’t done before. You might just discover skills you didn’t know you had.

People who are eager to reach their full potential can use this environment as a professional playground and become the most excellent version of themselves!

If this speaks to you, we strongly encourage you to send us an unsolicited application and let us know how you picture yourself contributing to the Y42 story and why. We will carefully check for any upcoming projects or challenges and get back to you with feedback.

About You

It doesn't matter whether you're still in school or have already held C-level positions. We have created entirely new roles for some of our wonderful talents in the past, and we will continue to do so. Everyone carries a unique set of valuable skills and experiences.

The typical hiring process at Y42:

Application review

Screening call

Interview with hiring manager

Cultural fit interview

Reference check

Offer

As soon as a suitable role becomes available, we will reach out to you. To make this process faster, we would like to know a few things about you.
Show more
HTML:
Founded in 2020, Y42 is a fast-growing company of70+ambitious and dedicated experts from all over the world who are on a mission to reshape the data space. We are backed by some of the world’s most renowned investors, having raised $34m in funding (Series A + seed round). This enabled us to build one of the largest tech and product teams across all European Series A-funded startups with 50+team members.

We work together to create an environment for people with open minds who want to grow and have an impact. Being a part of Y42 means constant growth and opportunity. We are all highly ambitious yet united in our mission to succeed as a team. Here, you can truly explore and redefine your own potential. We believe it is crucial for everyone here to find purpose in what they do, thrive, and feel like they belong. That is why we invite you to

Joining Y42 means joining our mission and contributing to our growth. A lot of what we are doing is unexplored, which means that you will find yourself doing things you haven’t done before. You might just discover skills you didn’t know you had.

People who are eager to reach their full potential can use this environment as a professional playground and become the most excellent version of themselves!

If this speaks to you, we strongly encourage you to send us an unsolicited application and let us know how you picture yourself contributing to the Y42 story and why. We will carefully check for any upcoming projects or challenges and get back to you with feedback.

About You

It doesn't matter whether you're still in school or have already held C-level positions. We have created entirely new roles for some of our wonderful talents in the past, and we will continue to do so. Everyone carries a unique set of valuable skills and experiences.

The typical hiring process at Y42:

Application review

Screening call

Interview with hiring manager

Cultural fit interview

Reference check

Offer

As soon as a suitable role becomes available, we will reach out to you. To make this process faster, we would like to know a few things about you.

Title: Business / Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Du liebst Musik? Dann hilf mit, sie zu schützen!




Die GEMA nimmt die Rechte der Musikschaffenden in Deutschland und die Rechte von über 2 Millionen Rechteinhabern und Rechteinhaberinnen aus aller Welt wahr. Wir sorgen dafür, dass die Urheber und Urheberinnen an den Einnahmen aus der Nutzung ihrer Musikwerke angemessen beteiligt werden und sich ganz auf ihr kreatives Schaffen konzentrieren können. Helfen Sie mit, Musikkultur zu fördern und zu ermöglichen! Unsere Haltung ist geprägt durch anspruchsvolles Agieren, initiatives Wirken, unternehmerisches Denken und Handeln, fairen und integren Umgang miteinander sowie die Übernahme von Verantwortung. Dies gibt uns Orientierung für unsere tägliche Arbeit.




Für unsere Abteilung Projekte, IT-Koordination, Analyse in der Direktion Förderstrukturen und Innovation Verteilung am Standort Berlin suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt eine/einen




Business / Data Analyst (m/w/d) in Vollzeit




Hier spielt die Musik – Dein Einsatzgebiet:




Du verantwortest die Entwicklung, Durchführung und Weiterentwicklung von Datenanalysen für direktionsinterne und –übergreifende Fachabteilungen und Projekte. Zudem organisierst und steuerst du weitere Services und Themen im Bereich der Datenanalyse.
Du übernimmst die bereichsübergreifende Analyse fachlicher Prozesse zur Verbesserung der Abläufe und Systeme
Du wirkst als Schnittstelle zwischen dem Fachbereich, IT und den Projekten
Du bist Ansprechpartner/in für Fachabteilungen in der Datenanalyse und damit verbundenem Anforderungs- und Testmanagement




Stimmig – Deine Qualifikationen:




Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich der Wirtschaftsinformatik, -mathematik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung mit hoher IT-Affinität
Du konntest umfassende Erfahrung mit Datenbanken, Big Data, KPI-Konzepten und betriebswirtschaftlichen Kennzahlen sammeln
Du hast sehr gute Kenntnisse in Datenbankabfrage- und Programmiersprachen (SQL, Python) sowie Erfahrung in zielgruppengerechter Aufbereitung von Analyseergebnissen mit entsprechenden Tools (Tableau, o.ä.).
Dein sehr gutes analytisches Denkvermögen, technische Affinität sowie eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe erleichtern dir den Arbeitsalltag
Kenntnisse im Anforderungsmanagement sowie Testmanagement (inkl. Kenntnisse gängiger Tools wie Jira o.ä.) sind wünschenswert
Du hast gute Präsentations- und Moderationsfähigkeiten und arbeitest gerne eigeninitiativ und flexibel
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift müssen wir voraussetzen
Deine Arbeitsweise ist proaktiv, dynamisch und selbstständig




Klangvoll – unsere Benefits:

Du bist uns wichtig! Deshalb gibt‘s flexible und familienfreundliche Arbeitszeitmodelle mit Gleitzeit, zusätzliche Unterstützungsangebote durch den pme Familienservice, ein umfassendes Gesundheitsprogramm und JobRad.
Wir entwickeln Dich weiter! Mit regelmäßigen Trainings, Workshops und Seminaren.
Wir entwickeln uns mit Dir weiter! Wir sind im kontinuierlichen Change. Dazu brauchen wir auch Deine Ideen!
Und das gibt es on top: 30 Tage Urlaub, vermögenswirksame Leistungen und Mitarbeiterrabatte.
Hauseigenes modernes Betriebsrestaurant mit Barista-Service – was bei uns auf den Tisch kommt, ist lecker! Sagen jedenfalls unsere Mitarbeitenden.
Ob Office oder mobile Work – die Mischung macht’s.




Bereit für den nächsten Karriereschritt in der Musikbranche?

Bist du an einer spannenden und facettenreichen Tätigkeit in der Musikbranche mit sympathischen und musikbegeisterten Teams in einer anspruchsvollen Arbeitsumgebung interessiert?

Dann freuen wir uns auf deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung.




GEMA

Gesellschaft für musikalische Aufführungs- und mechanische Vervielfältigungsrechte

Personalabteilung | Standort auswählen

www.gema.de

Show more

Title: Lead Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Berlin, London, Remote

________________________

Hello 👋 I am Puneet, Co- founder and CPO at Kayzen, and I am now looking for a Lead Data Analyst who will be a part of the our Data Analytics ( Data ) team. 🙌

But wait, you have not heard of Kayzen before? 😃

Kayzen is a mobile demand-side platform (DSP) dedicated to democratizing programmatic advertising. We enable leading apps, agencies, media buyers, and brands to run programmatic customer acquisition, retargeting, and brand performance campaigns through its self-serve and managed service options.

Built on the three core pillars of performance, transparency, and control, Kayzen powers the world's best mobile marketing teams with bespoke solutions that fuel business growth and deliver a competitive advantage.

With an unprecedented scale of 160B+ daily ad requests from 1.6B+ unique users worldwide, we serve up to 1B+ ads per day in 180 countries. Kayzen is accessible through our APIs and user interface.

The role

As the Lead Data Analyst, you will ensure that the Data Analytics team consistently applies advanced descriptive, prescriptive, and predictive analytics to deliver high-value insights across multiple stakeholders. At Kayzen, our Data Analytics team operates within the broader "Data Team," which also includes Data Science and Machine Learning Engineering. Collectively, the Data Team develops and deploys the machine learning models that power our clients' advertising performance in the programmatic ecosystem.

Within this structure, the Data Analytics team serves as a critical bridge between the Data Team and the broader business units (e.g., campaign managers, business owners, product managers).

Through your leadership, you will champion a data-driven culture and empower teams across Kayzen to harness analytical insights in a consistent and impactful way.

Responsibilities

As a hands-on leader, you will combine technical prowess with strategic vision—driving complex analysis, mentoring team members, and tackling data challenges directly. You will address a variety of problems, such as feature engineering, A/B testing, fraud detection, bidding decisions to name a few examples. Your key responsibilities include:


Team Leadership & Mentorship: Guide and develop the Data Analytics team, ensuring the quality and impact of their deliverables.
Roadmap Definition: Shape both the Data Analytics roadmap and the broader Data Team roadmap, making decisions that align with business priorities and objectives.
Data-Driven Model Research: Provide in-depth research to inform machine learning model development, leveraging both internal and external data sources to generate actionable insights.
Analytical & Statistical Expertise: Serve as the primary source of rigorous analytics for various data problems, evaluating system performance , finding performance issues and devising solutions for them
Data Accessibility & Quality Control: Facilitate data access throughout the organization while maintaining a centralized oversight to guarantee data quality.


What this role is not about:


This is not a typical BI role, where you are just expected to receive requirements and build dashboards. At Kayzen, the Data Analyst role is more investigative and we need people capable to ask questions and to answer them.
This is not a campaign management role, where you will be responsible for operational campaign optimization.


Requirements


5+ years of experience in the Ad-Tech industry, working in Data Analytics or related fields;
SQL (advanced);
Python (intermediate);
Expertise in data mining, processing, modeling and data visualization and strong analytical skills;
A results-driven, hands-on mindset that combines rapid experimentation, pragmatic problem-solving, and a passion for delivering exceptional customer-focused solutions;
High level of proactiveness and eagerness to solve issues;
A strong sense of ownership and strong work ethics;
Experience with Big Data technologies (Spark, HDFS, Hive, etc) is a plus;
Experience with Git and Airflow is a plus.


What do we offer?


Reporting directly to Co-founder & CPO
Direct access to top management and an extremely "visible" role
Exceptional career growth and learning opportunity
A unique opportunity to be part of an experienced team of industry experts and entrepreneurs who bring massive change to the Adtech market
Direct, day-to-day work experience with the management
A fun, driven, and multinational team located across Germany, India, UK, Argentina, Ukraine, Turkey, Spain and many more countries
A flexible work-from-home arrangement
A 500-dollar home-office setup budget
A 1000-dollar annual learning and development budget

  • Direct access to top management and an extremely "visible" role
  • Exceptional career growth and learning opportunity
  • A unique opportunity to be part of an experienced team of industry experts and entrepreneurs who bring massive change to the Adtech market
  • Direct, day-to-day work experience with the management
  • A fun, driven, and multinational team located across Germany, India, UK, Argentina, Ukraine, Turkey, Spain and many more countries

  • A 500-dollar home-office setup budget
  • A 1000-dollar annual learning and development budget

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Company Description

At Enpal, we are pursuing the dream of building the largest renewable community in Europe. How do we make that happen? Enpal finally simplifies providing solar energy: We rent out solar systems, electricity storage, and wall boxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a favorable green electricity tariff; all intelligently connected to form an integrated overall solution. True to the motto "digital, decentralized, and 100% renewable", our heart beats both for the rapid development of a company and for combating the greatest challenge of our generation - climate change.

Job Description


Work closely with the Heat Pump division stakeholders to design, build, and maintain automated data pipelines and ensure the best-in-class reporting infrastructure.
Implement and maintain automated Reporting for different business units to provide visibility and performance tracking across segments.
Develop deep knowledge of customer journey processes and use it to empower the business stakeholders to optimize the conversion funnel and achieve operational excellence.



Qualifications


5+ years of relevant experience in business intelligence, data analytics or similar roles.
Enthusiasm for working in dynamic, rapidly changing environments.
Strong ability to analyse data, identify patterns, and communicate. technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proven track record in automating data pipelines.
Exposure to Python for data analysis (e.g. pandas).
Our BI stack includes Snowflake, Streamlit, Tableau and dbt. Familiarity with the two latter ones is required/desired.
High proficiency in SQL and ETL processes.



Additional Information


The chance to be part of a fast-growing and future-oriented startup: we are one of the biggest players in the solar business.
A hybrid work model, the ability to come to our Berlin office every now and then for in person discussions and events, or to be there all the time - you decide.
Work with the best in the industry and grow with us: there’s plenty of room for your ideas.
Help to make the world a bit better: we are all about green energy.



At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.

Title: Social Media Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Daten über das Social Media Verhalten deiner Zielgruppe faszinieren dich? Du liebst es, aus einer großen, ungeordneten Menge an Zahlen, konkrete Schlüsse zu ziehen und dein gewonnenes Wissen für andere verständlich zu machen? Du bist außerdem detailverliebt und hast Lust neue Prozesse mitzugestalten?

Dann sucht unser Team Dich! Als Social Media Analyst (w/m/d).

Bewirb Dich! Auch wenn das Profil auf den ersten Blick nicht zu 100% passt.

Aufgaben


Auswertung und Analyse von Performance-Daten auf allen relevanten Social-Media-Kanälen
Nutzung von Analyse-Tools (Sprinklr, Google Analytics, Google Looker Studio etc.)
Ableiten und Präsentieren von relevanten Erkenntnissen und Empfehlungen
Optimierung/Automatisierung von Datenverarbeitung und Prozessen
Visuelle Datenaufbereitung & Dashboarding
Unterstützung von interdisziplinären Projektteams
Die Chance, mit einer der weltweit führenden Automobilmarken zu arbeiten



Qualifikation


Expertise im Bereich Social Media Analytics, zusätzliche Kenntnisse in Social-Media-Strategie und Advertising
Ein Gespür für Zahlen
Kompetenz im Umgang mit den aktuell relevanten Social-Media-Netzwerken
Fähigkeit zum Aufbau vertrauensvoller Kund:innenbeziehungen
Sicherer Umgang mit MS Office und eine unbändige Excel-Leidenschaft
Ausgezeichnete Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse
Interesse an der Automobilbranche ist von Vorteil



Benefits


Hybrides Arbeitszeitmodell mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten
Regelmäßige Teamevents
Bis zu vier Wochen im Jahr im EU-Ausland arbeiten
30 Urlaubstage für alle Mitarbeiter:innen
Unbefristeter Vertrag nach 6-monatiger Probezeit
Raum zur Entfaltung und zum eigenverantwortlichen Arbeiten in deiner neuen Rolle
Jährliches Weiterbildungsbudget mit individuellem Gestaltungsspielraum



Wer wir sind

Seit 2008 Kreativagentur und Unternehmensberatung mit über 200 sehr guten Leuten in Berlin-Kreuzberg.


Autonomie, Vertrauen und Gestaltungsspielraum sind unsere Vision der modernen Arbeitswelt von morgen.
Wir unterstützen uns gegenseitig und glauben an die kulturstiftende Wirkung von regelmäßigen Teamevents zur beruflichen und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung.
Diversity, Gleichberechtigung sowie eine gesunde Work-Life Balance gehören zu unseren wichtigsten Werten.
Unser transparenter Feedbackprozess trägt bei uns zu einer offenen und wertschätzenden Kommunikationskultur bei.
Wir wollen zu deinem Leben passen. Zur Unterstützung in jeder Lebensphase bieten wir den vollen Work-Life-Care-Service des Fürstenberg Instituts an.



Wir freuen uns über deine digitale Bewerbung unter Angabe deines optimalen Einstiegstermins.
Show more

Wer wir sind

Seit 2008 Kreativagentur und Unternehmensberatung mit über 200 sehr guten Leuten in Berlin-Kreuzberg.

  • Autonomie, Vertrauen und Gestaltungsspielraum sind unsere Vision der modernen Arbeitswelt von morgen.
  • Wir unterstützen uns gegenseitig und glauben an die kulturstiftende Wirkung von regelmäßigen Teamevents zur beruflichen und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung.
  • Diversity, Gleichberechtigung sowie eine gesunde Work-Life Balance gehören zu unseren wichtigsten Werten.
  • Unser transparenter Feedbackprozess trägt bei uns zu einer offenen und wertschätzenden Kommunikationskultur bei.
  • Wir wollen zu deinem Leben passen. Zur Unterstützung in jeder Lebensphase bieten wir den vollen Work-Life-Care-Service des Fürstenberg Instituts an.


Wir freuen uns über deine digitale Bewerbung unter Angabe deines optimalen Einstiegstermins.

Title: Staff Data Analyst
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to initiate and drive business decisions focusing on supply strategy
Help the supply business and tech teams learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams’ strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product and operational development and evaluation.


Who You Are


8+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Ability to collaborate with multiple teams to drive strategic decisions and execute on them
Strong project management skills
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity and reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem-solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.
